children.definition: commemorative inscription, D. 20.112: hence, = ἐπιγραφή I.4, App. Pun. 94.
short poem, usu. in elegiac verse, epigram, Hieronym.Rhod. ap. Ath. 13.604f, Callistr. ap. eund. 3.125c, etc.
title of a work, Alex. 135.4, 10, D.H. Rh. 8.8, Gal. 6.372, etc.; of a picture, Ael. VH 9.11.
written estimate or demand of damages, D. 38.2; title or label of a criminal charge, Arist. Rh. 1374a1.
mark branded on a slaveʼs forehead, Herod. 5.79.

definition: ἐπιγραμμάτιον, τό, Dim. of ἐπίγραμμα, Plu. Cat.Ma. 1, Antig. Mir. 89.
ἐπιγραμματιστής, οῦ, ὁ, = sq., Sidon.Apoll. Ep. 4.1.

children.definition: writing epigrams, prob. in AP 7.715 ( lemma), cf. Sch. Theoc. 7.40.
epigrammatist, Phld. Po. 5.35.9, D.L. 6.14.

definition: ἐπιγραμματοφόρος, ὁ, f.l. for -γράφος in AP 7.715 ( lemma), Tz. H. 8.425.

children.definition: markings, καθʼ ὅλον τὸ σῶμα Aët. 13.20.
superpostum (?), Gloss.
inscriber: at Athens, registrar of property, etc. (cf. sq. [ἐπιγραφή] II.2), Antipho Soph. 112, Poll. 8.103, AB 254, Harp.; prob. for -φῶν in Isoc. 17.41.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
inscription, στηλῶν on stones, Th. 2.43, cf. Arist. Mir. 843b17, J. AJ 15.8.1; on a vase, BCH 6.6 ( Delos, ii B.C.); on statues, Plb. 5.9.3.
title of a work, Id. 3.9.3, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 30, etc.
name of a ship, OGI 447 (i B.C.).
ascription of a deed to its author, credit or honour of a thing, τὴν ἐ. τινος λαβεῖν Plb. 1.31.4, cf. PSI 4.424.9 (iii B.C.); ἀπενέγκασθαι D.S. 16.50.cf. Jul. Caes. 322d.
insertion, interlineation in a document, PLond. 2.178.13 ii A.D.), PRyl. 316.2 (pl., ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: description of parties in pleadings, Is. 4.2.
registration of property for taxation, in pl., Isoc. 17.41 codd. (v. foreg.).
impost, tax, PSI 5.510.11 (iii B.C.); assessment, POxy. 1445.8 (ii A.D.), etc.
requisition, ὑποζυγίων BCH 46.309 ( Teos).
concerning assessments(?), IG 11(2).159 A 64 ( Delos, iii B.C.).

mark the surface, graze, ὀϊστὸς ἐπέγραψε χρόα φωτός Il. 4.139, cf. 13.553, Poll. 4.179; μιν ἐπιγράψας having put a mark on the lot, Il. 7.187; ἄκροις δακτύλοις ἐ. trifle with dishes, Luc. Am. 42.—In Hom. the word has not the sense of writing.

children.label: II
children.definition: write upon, inscribe, γράμματα Hdt. 3.88; τάδε Id. 4.88; ἐ. ὀνομαστὶ τὰς πόλεις Th. 1.132, cf. D. 59.97; ἐπίγραμμα ὃ . . προείλεθʼ ἡ πόλις αὐτοῖς ἐπιγράψαι Id. 18.289: abs., ἐ. τοῖς ἀναθήμασι IG 1(2).76.43; esp. write or place an epitaph on a tomb, ib. 14.1835, al., 7.2543.9: Med., have inscribed, ἐπεγράφου τὴν Γοργόνα Ar. Ach. 1095 (with play on III.5); ἐλεγεῖον Th. 1.132:— Pass., of the inscription, to be inscribed upon, ἐπιγέγραπταί οἱ τάδε Hdt. 5.77, cf. 7.228; τῶν τῷ χρυσέῳ ἐπιγέγραπται Λακεδαιμονίων Id. 1.51; [ ἐπίγραμμα] ὃ Μίδᾳ φασὶν ἐπιγεγράφθαι over or on the tomb of Midas, Pl. Phdr. 264c; ἐπιστολὴ -γεγραμμένη addressed, of a letter, Plb. 16.36.4, cf. Plu. Cic. 15; also, to have something inscribed upon one, ἐπεγράφοντο ῥόπαλα, ὡς Θηβαῖοι ὄντες used to bear clubs upon their shields, X. HG 7.5.20; so ἀσπὶς ἐπιγεγραμμένη τὰς ὁμολογίας having the articles inscribed upon it, D.H. 4.58.

data.quote: ἐπίγραμμα ὃ . . προείλεθʼ ἡ πόλις αὐτοῖς ἐπιγράψαι

children.definition: entitle, τοῦτο τὸ δρᾶμα Καλλίμαχος ἐ. Εὐνοῦχον Ath. 11.496f; αἱ -όμεναι Μαιανδρίου ἱστορίαι Inscr.Prien. 37.104 (ii B.C.).

data.quote: τοῦτο τὸ δρᾶμα Καλλίμαχος ἐ. Εὐνοῦχον

children.definition: sign, append a signature to, ἄφεσιν PSI 4.392.6 (iii B.C.); ἐ. τὸν Ἀντώνιον sign Antonius’ name, App. BC 5.144; αὑτοῦ ποιήματα ἐπέγραψεν (sc. τοῖς Ἑρμαῖς) inscribed poems signed by himself, Pl. Hipparch. 228d.
write subsequently, αἱ ἐπιγραφεῖσαι διαθῆκαι J. AJ 17.9.4.
write over an erasure, POxy. 34.14 (ii A.D.).

set down the penalty or damages in the title of an indictment (cf. ἐπίγραμμα 4), τί δῆτά σοι τίμημʼ ἐπιγράψω τῇ δίκῃ; Ar. Pl. 480; μέχρι πεντήκοντα δραχμῶν καθʼ ἕκαστον ἀδίκημα ἐ. Lex ap. Aeschin. 1.38; τὰ ἐπιγεγραμμένα the damages claimed, D. 29.8, cf. Pl. Lg. 915a; τιμημάτων -μένων Isoc. 16.47:— Med., Lex ap. Aeschin. 1.16.

children.label: b
children.definition: assign a punishment, τὰ μέγιστα ἐπιτίμια Aeschin. 1.14:— Pass., Din. 2.12.

children.label: c
children.definition: make note of, enter, τὴν πρόφασιν, in inflicting a fine, Arist. Ath. 8.4.

register the citizens’ names and property, with a view to taxes, lay a public burden upon one (cf. ἐπιγραφή II.2), ἐμαυτῷ . . τὴν μεγίστην εἰσφοράν Isoc. 17.41, cf. Arist. Oec. 1351b2; ἐ. δήμοις καὶ δυνάσταις στρατιωτῶν καταλόγους Plu. Crass. 17, cf. PHib. 1.44.3 ( iii B.C., Pass.), etc.; but ἐ. τινὰ προστίμοις visit with penalties, D.S. 12.12 (s.v.l.).

data.quote: ἐ. δήμοις καὶ δυνάσταις στρατιωτῶν καταλόγους

children.label: b
children.definition: assess, τὸ τρίτον μέρος PEdgar 38.3:— Pass., τὸ τίμημα τὸ -γεγραμμένον τοῖς χρήμασιν Lys. 17.7.

register or enter in a public list, ἐπιγράψαι σφᾶς αὐτοὺς ἐπιτρόπους Is. 6.36; ἐ. τινὰ εἰς τοὺς πράκτορας register his name among the πράκτορες, Decr. ap. And. 1.77 ( Pass.):— Med., ἐπεγράψαντο πολίτας enrolled fresh citizens, Th. 5.4; ξένην καὶ ξένον γονέας -ψάμενος D. 57.51; πῶς οἷόν τε τῷ ἀνδρὶ δύο πατέρας -ψασθαι; Is. 4.4 (later in Act., ἑαυτῷ τινὰ πατέρα -γράφων claiming as his father, App. BC 1.32).

Med., ἐπιγράφεσθαι μάρτυρας cause to be endorsed on a deposition as witnesses, D. 54.31; κλητῆρα οὐδʼ ὁντινοῦν ἐπιγραψάμενος Id. 21.87; but ἐπιγράφεσθαι τίμημα τῷ κλήρῳ set oneʼs valuation on the property, Is. 3.2.

προστάτην ἐπιγράψασθαι choose a patron, and enter his name as such in the public register (as μέτοικοι at Athens were obliged to do), Ar. Pax 684; so prob. ἐπεγράφοντο shd. be restored for -γραφον in Luc. Peregr. 11; ἐπιγράψασθαί τινα κύριον D. 43.15; οἱ τὸν Πλάτωνα ἐπιγραφόμενοι, i.e. the Platonists, Luc. Herm. 14:— Pass., κύριος ἐπιγεγράφθαι D. 43.15, cf. POxy. 251.32 (i A.D.), al.

children.label: b
children.definition: Ὅμηρον ἐπιγράφεσθαι attribute oneʼs fluency to Homer, Luc. Dem.Enc. 2; πρεσβυτέρους ἐ. χρόνους claim the authority of greater antiquity, Id. Am. 35.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἐπιγράψαι ἐαυτὸν ἐπί τι claim credit for, Aeschin. 3.167; ἀλλοτρίοις ἐαυτὸν πόνοις Ael. NA 8.2, cf. Plu. Pomp. 31; αὐτὸς ἐ. τὴν νίκην claim as his own, J. AJ 7.7.5:—so Med. and Pass., τοιούτων ῥητόρων ἐπὶ τὰς τοῦ δήμου γνώμας ἐπιγραφομένων inscribing their names on . . , Aeschin. 1.188; ἐπιγράφεσθαι ἀλλοτρίαις γνώμαις D. 59.43; τὸν ἐπὶ τοῖς τῆς πόλεως ἀτυχήμασιν ἐπιγεγραμμένον Din. 1.29; οἱ ἐπιγεγραμμένοι ἢ φυλάττοντες the parties whose names were endorsed upon the συνθῆκαι as securities, Arist. Rh. 1376b4; οἱ ἐπιγραφόμενοι τοῖς δόγμασι D.H. 6.84; ἡμεῖς δʼ ἐσμὲν ἐπιγεγραμμένοι we are merely the endorsers, Men. 482.8.

data.quote: τὸν ἐπὶ τοῖς τῆς πόλεως ἀτυχήμασιν ἐπιγεγραμμένον

children.label: V
children.definition: ascribe to, τοῖς θεοῖς τὸ ἔργον Hld. 8.9 (but θεὸν τῇ πομπῇ Philostr. VA 8.12):— Med., Φοίβῳ τὰς ἀνίσους χεῖρας AP 9.263 ( Antiphil.).
claim credit for, τὰ ὑπὸ ἄλλων εὑρημένα J. AJ 3.4.2; assume, προσωνυμίαν Plu. Demetr. 42; ἐπεγράψατο τὴν ἑαυτοῦ προσηγορίαν Id. Tim. 36:— Pass., of books, to be ascribed, τινί Gal. 15.25.
predicate of, φυγὴν οὐ φυγόντι Philostr. VS 2.1.12.

somewhat hooked, of the beak of the ibis, Hdt. 2.76; of the muzzle of the βοῦς ἄγριος, Arist. HA 499a7; of horses and men, somewhat hook-nosed, Pl. Phdr. 253d, Euthphr. 2b, PPetr. 3p.7, al. (iii B.C.), etc.
hollow on the surface, dub.l. in S. OC 1492 (lyr.).
stern-cable, Ar. Fr. 80, cf. 426: written -γυιον in Aristid. Or. 23(42).17, Zonar., -γυον in IG 2(2).1611.255-8 (iv B.C.), Plb. 3.46.3, Harp. s.v. ἐπίγυον (v.l. ἐπόγυιον): scanned ⏑⏑_⏑ in Ar.
exercise excessively, Philostr. Gym. 51; exercise again, ib. 53:—Pass, take exercise at or in, τοῖσι γυμνασίοισι Hp. Insomn. 88: abs., dub. in Ph. 1.467.
lay bare, [ ὀστοῦν] σμίλῃ Pall. in Hp. Fract. 12.286C.
at the angle, μονάδες Nicom. Ar. 1.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐπιγώνια, τά, corner-stones or -columns, Aq. Ps. 143(144).12.
to be kindled at: metaph., delight greedily in, κίχλῃς -δαίεται ἦτορ Opp. H. 4.173, cf. Sch. ad loc.
distribute, ἐπιδαίομαι ὅρκον dub. sens. in h.Merc. 383:— Pass., δεκάτη δʼ ἐπὶ μοῖρα δέδασται Hes. Th. 789.
assigned, allotted, οἶκος Call. Jov. 59.
additional dish, dainty, Philem. ap. Ath. 14.646c; = ὄψον, Hsch.

bite: hence, of anything pungent, sting, cause to smart, ὁ καπνὸς ἐ. τὰς ὄψεις Arist. Fr. 660; of urine, Ath. 1.32e; ἐ. τὴν γεῦσιν Dsc. 2.166: metaph., Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 39xvi27:— Med., Nic. Al. 19, 121:— Pass., οἱ -όμενοι τὴν κύστιν Dsc. 1.112; of hunger, Apollod. ap.Suid. s.v. καρδιώττειν.
gnawing, dub.l. in Philagr. ap. Orib. 5.21.10.
tearful, Hsch. and Suid. s.v. μυδαλέον.
oozing, of blood, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.52.5.
weep over or for, πτώματι Ph. 2.44; τῇ μνήμῃ τινός Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.583c: abs., Ar. V. 882, Aeschin. 2.85:— Pass., ἐπιδακρυνθέντα· ἐπιγραφέντα (i.e. in a tomb inscription), Hsch.
ooze, exude, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.49.1.
those enjoying the privilege of ἐπιδαμία (v. ἐπιδημία) at Rhodes, IG 12(1).157.
hold office of ἐπιδαμιοργός, prob. in IG 9(1).330.2 ( Supp.Epigr. 2.354).
official at Delphi, Supp.Epigr. 2.263.35 (iii/ii B.C.), al.; at Sparta, IG 5(1).5 (iii/ii B.C.); at Ithaca, SIG 558.30 (iii B.C.); cf. ἐπιδημιουργός.
subdue, ἠϊθέους AP 12.96.5.

lend money on property already mortgaged, D. 35.22, PPetr. 3p.41 (iii B.C.); ἐ. ἐπὶ κτήμασι Arist. Oec. 1347a1; ἱερατικὰς προσόδους ἐ. PGnom. 184 (ii A.D.):— Med., borrow on property already mortgaged, D. 34.6, Syngr. ap. eund. 35.11: metaph., ἐπιδανείζεσθαι χρόνον παρὰ τῆς τύχης εἰς ἄδοξον βίον Plu. Brut. 33.

data.quote: ἐπιδανείζεσθαι χρόνον παρὰ τῆς τύχης εἰς ἄδοξον βίον

children.definition: exhaust, consume as well, Pall. Febr. 23.
steward, Gloss.
assessment, PSI 8.901.11 (i A.D.).
hairy, Thphr. HP 3.18.5.
abound, be abundant, Ister 43, Hsch. s.v. Συβαριτικοὶ λόγοι: but more commonly,

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., lavish upon a person, bestow freely, τὰς ἑωυτῶν μητέρας καὶ τὰς ἀδελφεὰς ὑμῖν Hdt. 5.20, cf. Ph. 1.400; [ τὰν δαπάναν] Supp.Epigr. 1.327.7 ( Callatis, i A.D.); ἐ. τινί τοῦ γέλωτος give him freely of it, X. Cyr. 2.2.15: metaph., illustrate more richly, Luc. DMort. 24[30].2.

data.quote: τὰς ἑωυτῶν μητέρας καὶ τὰς ἀδελφεὰς ὑμῖν

children.definition: to be lavish, Arist. VV 1250b25, Ph. 2.170; ἔν τινι D.H. Rh. 6.2, Luc. Pr.Im. 14.

in need of, τινός Pl. Ti. 33c, v.l. in X. Cyr. 8.7.12, etc.: pl., -δεέες v.l. in Hdt. 4.130: Comp. -έστερος ἐκείνων inferior to . . , Pl. Plt. 311b: Sup. -έστατος most in need, πλείστων Id. R. 579e. Adv. -εῶς inadequately, Id. Lg. 899d.
pattern, example, X. Smp. 6.6, PTeb. 25.18 (ii B.C.); σοφίας πλείστης Pl. Hp.Mi. 368c; προνοίας Gal. UP 15.4.
display, ἐ. ἐπιδεικνύναι X. Cyr. 8.2.15; τὰ τῶν πλουσίων ἐ. show-pieces, gauds, Demetr. Eloc. 108.

children.label: II
children.definition: memorial, χειμῶνος μεγάλου Epigr. ap. Str. 2.1.16.
fear, κτύπον Nonn. D. 28.330.
at even, about evening: neut. pl. ἐπιδείελα as Adv., Hes. Op. 810, 821 (nisi leg. ἐπὶ δείελα).

definition: ἐπιδείκνυμι, ἐπιδεικνύω PPetr. 2p.110 (iii B.C.)), fut. -δείξω: aor. ἐπέδειξα, Ion. ἐπέδεξα Hdt. 2.42:—

children.definition: exhibit as a specimen, Ar. Ach. 765: generally, display, exhibit, βίαν Pi. N. 11.14; τεκμήρια A. Supp. 53 (lyr.), etc.; ἑωυτόν τινι Hdt. 2.42; πᾶσαν τὴν Ἑλλάδα τινί Id. 3.135, cf. 6.61; ἐ. τὸ στράτευμά τινι parade it before . . , X. An. 1.2.14, cf. Cyr. 5.5.5; of speeches, compositions, etc., ἐπιδειξάτω τῇ βουλῇ he shall exhibit his draft, IG 1(2).76.60; ἐ. λόγον Ar. Eq. 349; ῥαψῳδίαν Pl. Lg. 658b, cf. Isoc. 2.7 ( Pass.); σοφίαν Pl. Euthd. 274a, X. Smp. 3.3.

Med., show off or display for oneself or what is oneʼs own, μουσικὰν ὀρθὰν ἐ. give a specimen of his art . . , Pi. Fr. 32; ἐμὲ ἐπεδέξατο γυμνήν exhibited me naked, Hdt. 1.11; πάντα τὸν στρατόν showed all his army, Id. 7.146; ἐ. τὸν Ἀλέξανδρον recall Alexander, Plu. Pyrrh. 8; esp. of oneʼs personal qualities, ἐπιδείκνυσθαι τὴν αὑτοῦ δύναμιν And. 4.14; σοφίαν, πονηρίαν, Pl. Phdr. 258a, Isoc. 20.4, cf. X. An. 1.9.16; ἐπιδείξασθαι αὑτὸν ἀβέβηλον Inscr.Prien. 113.66 (i B.C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: ἐπίδειξαι . . ἅττʼ ἐδίδασκες give a specimen of . . , Ar. Nu. 935; τὰ γυμνικά POxy. 42.5 (iv A.D.): abs., show off, make a display of oneʼs powers, ἐπεδείκνυτο τοῖς λωποδύταις Ar. Ra. 771; ὃν . . ἐθεάσασθε ἐπιδεικνύμενον giving a display (of fighting in armour), Pl. La. 179e; of a rhetorician lecturing, Id. Phdr. 235a; πολλὰ καὶ καλά Id. Grg. 447a; of epideictic orators, Arist. Rh. 1391b26; of a musician, Ael. VH 9.36: c. part., ἐ. ὑπερθέων Pl. Lg. 648d.

children.label: II
children.definition: show, point out, τινὶ τὴν αἰτίαν Id. Phd. 100b, cf. Aeschin. 1.177; τὴν πονηρίαν Pl. Prt. 346a; ἐ. αὐτήν, ἥτις ἐστίν Pl.Com. 173.5; ἐ. τὸν ἀλεκτρυόνʼ ὡς ἐτυράννει show, prove that . . , Ar. Av. 483, cf. Lys. 1.4; ὅτι . . Pl. R. 391e, etc.: c. part., ἐ. πάντα ἐόντα μεγάλα Hdt. 1.30; ἐ. τινὰ φονέα ὄντα show that one is a murderer, v.l. in Antipho 1.3, cf. Th. 3.64 (where perh. ἐπ- ‘as an afterthought’); ἐ. τινὰ δωροδοκήσαντα prove that one took bribes, Ar. Eq. 832 (anap.); ἐπιδείξω σε ταῦτα ὁμολογοῦντα Pl. Euthd. 295a, cf. Chrm. 158d; ψυχὴν ἐ. πρεσβυτέραν οὖσαν τοῦ σώματος Id. Lg. 892c; ἐ. αὑτὸν φοβερὸν (sc. ὄντα) καὶ μέγα δυνάμενον And. 4.11: c. acc., ἐ. ὅ τι ἂν ἐγκαλῇ ἐναντίον ἀνδρῶν τριῶν PEleph. 1.7 (iv B.C.), etc.:— Pass., ἐπιδείκνυται αὐθέντης (sc. ὤν) Antipho 3.4.9; ἐπεδείχθησαν οὐδὲν βελτίους ὄντες Isoc. 4.145, cf. 18.56; κινδυνεύσεις ἐπιδεῖξαι χρηστὸς εἶναι X. Mem. 2.3.17 ( ἐπιδεῖξαι secl. Cobet).

data.quote: ψυχὴν ἐ. πρεσβυτέραν οὖσαν τοῦ σώματος
ἐ. αὑτὸν φοβερὸν (sc. ὄντα) καὶ μέγα δυνάμενον
ἐ. ὅ τι ἂν ἐγκαλῇ ἐναντίον ἀνδρῶν τριῶν

children.definition: Med., τῆς αἰτίας τὸ εἶδος Pl. Phd. 100b; ἔργῳ ἐπεδείκνυτο, ὅτι . . X. An. 1.9.10, cf. Is. 5.30.
one must display, τὴν εὐψυχίαν X. Cyn. 10.21, etc.
one must point out, Gal. 10.222; one must prove, ὅτι . . Porph. Abst. 3.9.
wish to display oneself, Com.Adesp. 1008.
fit for displaying or showing off, ἤθους καὶ πάθους Luc. Salt. 35; ἡ ἐπιδεικτική display, Pl. Sph. 224b.

ἐ. λόγοι speeches for display, set orations, D. 61.2; ἐ. γένος λόγων Arist. Rh. 1358b8; ὁ ἐ. declamatory speaker, ib. 1359a15, cf. Plu. Comp.Dem.Cic. 1. Adv. -κῶς, πολεμεῖν Id. Luc. 11; ἐ. ἔχειν Isoc. 4.11: Comp. -ώτερον, γράφε ν Plu. Aud.poet. 2.28e.
Apollon. Lex.
showing forth, making known, τοῦτο ἐς ἐ. ἀνθρώπων ἀπίκετο became notorious, Hdt. 2.46.

exhibition, display, demonstration, τῆς δυνάμεως Th. 6.31; ἐ. ποιεῖσθαι, of a military demonstration, Id. 3.16; ἓν τοῦτʼ ἦν τῆς ἐ. showing off, Pl. Grg. 447c: generally, ἐ. ποιήσασθαι ᾗ . . exhibit how . . , Id. Phd. 99d; ἐλθεῖν εἰς ἐπίδειξίν τινι come to display oneself to one, Ar. Nu. 269; ἡ ἐ. (sc. τοῦ κάλλους) X. Mem. 3.11.2; ἐ. ποιήσασθαι τῆς σοφίας Arist. Pol. 1259a19.
λόγων ἐ. ποιεῖσθαι D. 18.280: abs., set speech, declamation, Th. 3.42; ἐ. ποιήσασθαι Pl. Grg. 447c, cf. Isoc. 4.17, 5.17: pl., SIG 577.53 ( Milet., iii/ii B.C.), 775.3 ( Delph., i B.C.).
proof, Men. 161.2 (pl.), PTaur. 1.1 vii 7 (pl., ii B.C.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: example, ἐπίδειξις Ἑλλάδι an example to Greece, E. Ph. 871; ἐπίδειξιν ποιεῖσθαί τινι ὡς . . give a sign or proof that . . , Aeschin. 1.47.
eat a second meal, Hp. VM 10, Acut. 28.

children.label: II
children.definition: dine, sup off, Ar. Eq. 1140, Ec. 1178 (both lyr.); τῶν πράσων Alex. 242.

children.label: III
children.definition: sup at or upon, σκεῦος ᾧ τις ἐ. Artem. 1.74.
after dinner, ἐ. ἀφῖχθαι Luc. Lex. 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: convivial, βασιλεύς Them. Or. 2.36a (prob.).

definition: ἐπιδειπνίς, ίδος, ἡ, = sq., Ph. 2.479 (pl.), Petron. 69, Mart. 11.31.7 (pl.); said to be Maced. by Ath. 14.658e.

children.definition: second course, dessert, Ath. 14.664e (pl., s.v.l.).

definition: ἐπιδεκατεία( ἐπιδεκατ-ία Thrasyll. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).101), ἡ, Astrol.,

children.definition: Vett.Val. 102.33.
Heph.Astr. 1.16 [1.40], Thrasyll. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).101), Vett.Val. 102.27 ( Pass.), Porph. in Ptol. 188.
containing an integer and one-tenth: hence ἐ. λόγος ratio of 11 : 10, lamb. in Nic. p.54P.

children.label: II
children.definition: one in ten: hence Subst. -δέκατον, τό,
tenth, tithe, Lex ap. And. 1.96, X. HG 1.7.10, Lex ap. D. 43.71; ἐ. τόκοι interest of 10%, IG 1(2).377, Arist. Rh. 1411a17, Oec. 1346b32.
payment of 10% on account, IG 11.161 A79 ( Delos, iii B.C.).
payment of 10% as παρακαταβολή (q.v.), ib. 5(2).357 ( Stymphalus), PHal. 1.63 (iii B.C.); προδικία ἄνευ ἐπιδεκάτων IG 12 (8).640 ( Peparethus, ii B.C.).
additional, extra payment of one-tenth, PHib. 1.32.9 (iii B.C.), PAmh. 2.33.32 (ii B.C.).
one must acquiesce in, τὸ παραγγελλόμενον Plb. 36.5.4.
capable of containing πόλεων Str. 3.4.13.
capable of, c.gen., Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.64, Phld. Ir. p.81 W.; admitting, ἄρθρου A.D. Pron. 63.19; γύμνασμα ἐ. ἠθῶν καὶ παθῶν Theon Prog. 10; receptive, ἐ. αἴτιον, opp. ποιητικόν, Alex.Aphr. Febr. 25.
accepted, Sm., Thd. Is. 60.7; also gloss on ἐπιδεκτικός, Hsch.
δίκας Aesara ap. Stob. 1.49.27.
to be put on as a bait, D.S. 1.35.
on the bed or bed-clothes, ἐπιδέμνιος ὡς πέσοιμʼ ἐς εὐνάν E. Hec. 927 (lyr.).
build upon, τινί τι Opp. C. 4.121.
on or in the tree, [ σῦκον] Jul. Ep. 180p.393b.

definition: ἐπίδενδρος, ον, = foreg., ὄφις Teucr. ap. Boll Sphaera p. 17.

children.definition: Sm. Is. 1.6 ( Pass.).

definition: ἐπιδεξιελεύθερος, f.l. in Pl. Tht. 175e ap.Suid. s.v. ἀναλαμβάνειν.

children.definition: entertain one another, Anaximen. ap. D.L. 2.4.
towards the right, i.e. from left to right:

children.label: I
children.definition: Hom. only in neut. pl. as Adv., ὄρνυσθʼ ἑξείης ἐπιδέξια rise in order, Od. 21.141, cf. Pl. Smp. 214b; περίιθι τὸν βωμὸν ἐ. Ar. Pax 957; πίνειν τὴν ἐ. (sc. κύλικα) Eup. 325, cf. Anaxandr. 1.4, Critias 33 D.; without idea of motion, ἕστηκεν ἐ. Lys. Fr. 94; sts. as two words, ἐπὶ δεξιά, opp. ἐπʼ ἀριστερά, Il. 7.238, cf. Eust.ad Od. l.c.; ἐπὶ δ. χειρός Pi. P. 6.19, Theoc. 25.18; τὰ ἐπὶ δ., opp. τὰ ἐπʼ ἀριστερά, Hdt. 2.93, 4.191, 6.33.
auspicious, lucky, ἀστράπτων ἐ. Il. 2.353.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., = δεξιός, on the right hand, X. An. 6.4.1, etc.; τἀπιδέξια the right side, Ar. Av. 1493 (lyr.); οἱ ἐ. ἄνεμοι Arist. Pr. 941b12.

clever, dexterous, tactful, Aeschin. 1.178, Arist. EN 1128a17, Thphr. Char. 29.4; λαβὴ φιλοσόφων ἐπιδέξιος ἡ διὰ τῶν ὤτων Zeno Stoic. 1.64: c. inf., Arist. Rh. 1381a34; ἐ. πρὸς τὰς ὁμιλίας Plb. 5.39.6; περί τι Plu. Aem. 37, D.C. 69.10: Sup., Ἀφροδίτην -ωτάτην θεῶν Plu. QConv. 2.739e: neut. pl. as Adv., ἐπιδέξια dexterously, cleverly, Anaxandr. 53.5, Nicom.Com. 1.27; elegantly, ἀναβάλλεσθαι ἐ. Pl. Tht. 175e: Regul. Adv. -ίως Erasistr. ap. Gal. 7.539, Plb. 3.19.13, 4.35.7, Corn. ND 14, Plu. Virt. doc. 2.439e.

data.quote: λαβὴ φιλοσόφων ἐπιδέξιος ἡ διὰ τῶν ὤτων

children.definition: lucky, prosperous, τύχη D.S. 8.4.
handiness, cleverness, tact, Pittac. ap. Stob. 3.1.172, Aeschin. 2.47, Arist. EN 1128a17: pl., Plu. Virt.mor. 2.441b.

children.label: II
children.definition: position on the right, Paul.Al. E. 3.

definition: ἐπιδεξιπολίης ἐκ τῶν δεξιῶν μερῶν περιστρέψας, Hsch.
ἐπίδεξις, εως, ἡ, Ion. for ἐπίδειξις.

children.definition: look upon, behold, τι, τινάς, Hes. Op. 268, Th. 760, etc.; Hom. only as v.l., Od. 11.16.
to be seen, visible, τινί Emp. 2.7.
peel, Erot.

children.label: II
children.definition: skin, αἰγός Alex.Trall. 1.15.
outer skin, epidermis, Hp. Nat.Puer. 20, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: web of water-birds’ feet, Arist. ap. Sch. Il. 2.460.
bandaging, Hp. Art. 14, VC 13, Gal. 14.793.
binding, κεραμίδων PLond. 1.177.164 (ii A.D.).
Hp. Fract. 21, Art. 14, etc.
bind up, AP 11.125.
bind up or on, Pall. in Hp.Fract. 12.284 C., Paul.Aeg. 3.35, Hippiatr. 11.
Hsch.

definition: ἐπιδεσμίς, ίδος, ἡ, = sq., Gal. 14.794, Cass. Pr. 57.

children.definition: upper or outer bandage, Hp. Off. 9, Ar. V. 1440, Arist. HA 630a6, Ph. Bel. 96.19: metaph., of fortresses as the ‘fetters’ of Greece, Str. 9.4.15: heterocl. pl. ἐπίδεσμα Ael. NA 8.9:—also ἐπί-δεσμον, τό, Gal. 13.686.
bandage-loving, of gout, Luc. Trag. 198.
to be lord over, στρατῷ A. Pers. 241.
one must bind on, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.21.9, Gal. 18(2).897.
application under a bandage, Hp. Mul. 1.78.

in need or want of, lacking, c. gen., δαιτὸς ἐΐσης, κρειῶν, γάλακτος, etc., Il. 9.225, Od. 4.87, etc.; βιότου Hes. Th. 605; λώβης τε καὶ αἴσχεος οὐκ ἐπιδευεῖς lacking not scathe nor scorn, Il. 13.622; τῶν πάντων ἐπιδευέες (v.l. -δεέες) Hdt. 4.130: abs., ὅς κʼ ἐπιδευής whoever be in want, Il. 5.481, cf. Parm. 8.33.

children.label: II
children.definition: lacking, failing, ἵνα μή τι δίκης ἐπιδευὲς ἔχῃσθα that thou mayʼst have no point of right wanting, Il. 19.180: c. gen., βίης ἐπιδευέες failing in strength, Od. 21.185; ἐ. θέσφατα μαντοσύνης A.R. 2.315: as Comp., βίης ἐπιδευέες εἰμὲν ἀντιθέου Ὀδυσῆος inferior to Ulysses in strength, Od. 21.253, cf. h.Ap. 338: and abs., πολλὸν δʼ ἐπιδευέες ἦμεν far too weak were we, Od. 24.171: c. inf., τεθνάκην ὀλίγω ʼπιδεύης cj. in Sapph. 2.15.

definition: ἐπιδεύομαι, Ep. for ἐπιδέομαι (v. ἐπιδέω (B) II),

children.definition: to be in want of, lack, c. gen. rei, χρυσοῦ ἐπιδεύεαι Il. 2.229, cf. Od. 15.371, Nic. Th. 57; need the help of, c. gen. pers., σεῦ ἐπιδευομένους Il. 18.77.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be lacking in, fall short of, c. gen. rei, μάχης ἐπιδεύομαι 23.670, cf. 17.142: also c. gen. pers., πολλὸν κείνων ἐπιδεύεαι ἀνδρῶν fallest far short of them, 5.636; or both together, οὔ τι μάχης ἐπιδεύετʼ Ἀχαιῶν 24.385: later c. acc. rei, ἀλκήν A.R. 2.1220.—The Act. occurs only in Aeol. fut. inf. ἐπιδεύσην, f.l. in Sapph. 2.15 (v. ἐπιδευής).
secondary, of minor rank, of a dramatist, Suid. s.v. Ἀριστομένης.
repeat, AB 93.
repetition, Sm. Ps. 76(77).11.
moisten, AP 7.208 ( Anyte, tm.):— Pass., αἵματι κρητήρ Orph. A. 1076.

definition: ἐπιδέχομαι, Ion. etc. ἐπιδέκομαι Hdt. (v. infr.), Leg.Gort. 11.25:—

children.definition: admit besides or in addition, Hdt. 8.75.
receive besides, Men. 583.
receive, welcome, τινὰς φιλανθρώπως Plb. 21.18.3; ἐ. εἰς τὰ οἰκητήρια POxy. 281.9 (i A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: take on oneself, undertake, πόλεμον Plb. 4.31.1; τὴν στεφανηφορίαν Inscr.Prien. 108.255 (ii B.C.), cf. POxy. 498.6 (ii A.D.), etc.: c. inf., ib. 102.7 (iv A.D.): abs., agree, admit liability, PAmh. 2.31.12 (ii B.C.).

allow of, admit of, κατηγορίαν D. 10.28; λόγον Arist. Cat. 3b2; τὸ μᾶλλον καὶ τὸ ἧττον ib. 6a19; ἐναντιότητα ib. 11b1; τὴν μεσότητα Id. EN 1107a8; τἀκριβές ib. 1094b25; δόξαν αἰτίας Aeschin. 1.48, cf. Hero Aut. 1.7: c. inf., ὁ χρόνος οὐκ ἐπιδέχεται μακρολογεῖν Din. 1.31.
expect, await, βαρεῖαν ἐπιδέγμενοι ἀνάγκαν B. 16.96.
accept a term as applying to, ἐπί τινος Ascl. Tact. 11.2 (v.l. ἐκδ-).
bind, fasten on, τὸν λόφον Ar. Ra. 1038:— Med., ἐπὶ τὰ κράνεα λόφους ἐπιδέεσθαι have crests fastened on . . , Hdt. 1.171: for Od. 21.391, v. πεδάω.

children.label: II
children.definition: bind up, bandage, Hp. VC 13, Fract. 21, Art. 14:— Pass., ἐπιδεδεμένος τραύματα with oneʼs wounds bound up, X. Cyr. 5.2.32, al.; ἐπιδεδεμένοι ἀντικνήμιον, χεῖρα, ib. 2.3.19.

want or lack of a number, τετρακοσίας μυριάδας . . ἐπιδεούσας ἑπτὰ χιλιάδων Hdt. 7.28: generally, to be in need of, Ocell. 1.8; τῆς τέχνης ἂν μόνον ἐπιδέοι would need nothing further but his skill, Pl. Lg. 709d: impers., ἐὰν δὲ καὶ ἄλλης ἐπιδέῃ βοηθείας D.H. 6.63.

data.quote: ἐὰν δὲ καὶ ἄλλης ἐπιδέῃ βοηθείας

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., to be in want of, τινός Hdt. 1.32, Pl. Smp. 204a, X. Smp. 8.16, etc.; ἀρχὴν τριάκοντα ἐπιδεομένην ἡμερῶν lacking thirty days of its expiry, Pl. Lg. 766c.
request, PMag.Lond. 121.546.
seen clearly, manifest, Thgn. 442; ἐ. εἶναί τινι Hdt. 8.97: ἐ. ποιεῖν τισί, ἤν . . Ar. Eq. 38: c. part., ἐ. ἐστι κλέπτων is detected stealing, Id. Ec. 661.
ἐ. μάλιστα γίνεται [ἄνθρωπος] ἀπὸ ἑπταετέος μεχρι τεσσαρεσκαιδεκαετέος formed, Hp. Carn. 13.

children.label: II
children.definition: indicative of a crisis to come, Id. Aph. 2.24, cf. Gal. 17(2).510: so in neut. pl., σῆς ἀρετῆς ἐπίδηλα as a witness of . . , IG 12(7).286 ( Amorgos).
distinguished, remarkable, X. Oec. 21.10.
like, resembling, τινί Ar. Pl. 368.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -λως Hp. Acut. 45, Arist. Cael. 297b34, etc.: Comp. -ότερον Id. GA 728b29, -οτέρως Id. HA 604a2: Sup. -ότατα ib. 510a5, -οτάτως Id. GA 727a23. (Cf. also ἐπίζηλος.)
indicate Arist. Mete. 373a31; νεύματί τι Philostr. VA 5.34.
cushion (?), dub. in Paul.Aeg. 2.48.
live among the people, live in the throng, opp. live in the country, Od. 16.28.

to be at home, live at home, opp. ἀποδημέω, Th. 1.136, Pl. Tht. 173e, etc.; παρόντες καὶ ἐπιδημοῦντες Antipho 6.46; ἐ. τρία ἔη And. 1.132; ἐ. Ἀθήνησι stay at home at Athens, D. 35.16; so ἐν αὐτῇ (sc. τῇ πόλει) ἐ. Pl. Cri. 52b; opp. στρατεύομαι, Is. 9.3.
to be prevalent, epidemic, Hp. Prog. 25.

children.label: II
children.definition: come home, X. Mem. 2.8.1; ἐνθάδε ἐ. Pl. Smp. 172c; εἰ νῦν ἐξ ἀγροῦ ἐνθάδʼ ἐπιδημεῖ Men. Georg. 19.

data.quote: εἰ νῦν ἐξ ἀγροῦ ἐνθάδʼ ἐπιδημεῖ

children.label: III
children.definition: come to stay in a city, reside in a place, οἱ -οῦντες ἐν Λακεδαίμονι ξένοι X. Mem. 1.2.61; ἐ. εἰς Μέγαρα come to Megara to stay there, D. 59.37, cf. Aeschin. 2.154; ἐκ Κλαζομενῶν Pl. Prm. 126b; ἐ. τοῖς μυστηρίοις to be present at, attend them, D. 21.176; τοὺς ἐπιδημήσαντας ἅπαντας τῶν Ἑλλήνων all who were present [at the festival], ib. 217; Φοίβου ἐπιδημήσαντος Call. Ap. 13: laterc. dat., ταῖς Σάρδεσιν Philostr. VS 1.22.4; also ἐν Μέμφει UPZ 42i4 (ii B.C.).
stay in a place, be in town, ὅσοι ξένοι ἐπιδημοῦσιν Lys. 12.35, cf. Inscr.Prien. 108.286 (ii B.C.), Act.Ap. 17.21; Πρωταγόρας ἐπιδεδήμηκεν; Pl. Prt. 309d: metaph., ἐ. θίασος Μουσῶν Ar. Th. 40.
ἐ. τινί visit a person, PLond. 2.416.5 (iv A.D.).
harangue over a person, App. BC 1.96.
f.l. in Pl. Ep. 330b.
staying at home, non-migratory, ζῷα, opp. ἐκτοπιστικά, Arist. HA 488a13.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐπιδημητικά, τά, expenses of a governorʼs visit, Cod.Just. 12.40.12.
stay in a place, Pl. Prm. 127a; αἱ ἐ. αἱ τῶν συμμάχων X. Ath. 1.18; of an Emperor, visit, OGI 517.7 ( Thyatira, iii A.D.), Hdn. 3.14.1.
ἐ. εἰς . . arrival at . . IG 3.1023.
prevalence of an epidemic, νουσήματος Hp. Nat.Hom. 9; of rain, Ael. NA 5.13.
Dor. ἐπιδᾱμία, ἡ, right of residence, IG 12(1).43 ( Rhodes).
epidemic, νοσήματα Pall. in Hp. 2.2 D.

definition: ἐπιδήμιος, ον (but α, ον IG 9(1).333.7 ( Locr.)),

children.definition: among the people, ἐπιδήμιοι ἁρπακτῆρες plunderers of oneʼs own countrymen, Il. 24.262; πόλεμος ἐ. civil war, 9.64; ἐπιδαμίᾳ δίκᾳ χρήστω IG l.c.; ἔφαντʼ ἐ. εἶναι σὸν πατέρʼ that he was at home, Od. 1.194; ἐ. ἔμποροι resident merchants, Hdt. 2.39; οὐδʼ εὐνῆς αἰδὼς ἐ. A.R. 2.1023: generally, common, commonplace, τοῦτο τοὐπιδήμιον Plu. QConv. 2.735a.

data.quote: ἔφαντʼ ἐ. εἶναι σὸν πατέρʼ that he was

children.definition: sojourning among, ψυχὴ . . ἐ. ἄστροις IG 12(8).609.3 ( Thasos); settling in a place, A.R. 1.827.
prevalent, epidemic, ἴκτερος Hp. Int. 37.
ἐπιδήμια θύειν sacrifice in honour of a visit or arrival, Him. Ecl. 36.1.
order perfectly, of the stars, Hp. Ep. 18 ( Pass.).

definition: ἐπιδημιουργοί, οἱ, magistrates sent annually by Doric states to their colonies, Th. 1.56.

children.label: II
children.definition: Procop. Arc. 25, al.
Antiph. 11; οὐ τυγχάνει ἐ. ὤν not at home, Ar. Fr. 390; ἐπίδᾱμος φάτις Οἰδιπόδα the popular current report concerning, S. OT 495 (lyr.).
sojourning in a place, Call. Dian. 226; Δήλῳ δʼ ἦν ἐπίδημος, of Artemis, Id. Aet. 3.1.26 [Fr. 75.26 Pf.]; οἱ ἐπίδᾱμοι GDI 5040 ( Hierapytna), cf. Milet. 3.149 (ii B.C.).
prevalent, epidemic, Hp. Epid. 1.14.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἐ. βιβλία writings on epidemic diseases, Pall. in Hp.Fract. 12.271C.

cross over after another, Hdt. 4.122, 6.70; ἐ. τάφρον Th. 6.101; [ ποταμόν] X. HG 5.3.4, etc.; ἐ. ἐπί τινα, τινί, cross a river to attack an enemy, force the passage, Plb. 3.14.8, Str. 2.5.8, cf. D.C. 60.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: pass all bounds, ταῖς ἐλπίσιν J. AJ 15.7.9.
spread, of diseases, ἄχρι τῆς καρδίας Gal. 8.297; ἐπὶ γόνατα Aët. 12.2.
criticize, Philostr. VS 2.9.3.
consider afresh, Hdt. 1.133.
pay in addition, PRev.Laws 34.14 (iii B.C.); -γραφήσω f.l. in Vett.Val. 348.11.
additional will, codicil, J. AJ 17.9.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: pledge, security, Lys. Fr. 110 S.
further incision, Heliod. ap. Orib. 46.8.4, Gal. 1.386.
one must make a further incision, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.12.3, cf. Gal. 17(1).434.

divide, distribute, ἑκάστῳ ἄρτους ἑξήκοντα l.c., cf. Plb. 1.73.3; κρέα Schwyzer 726.33 ( Milet., v B.C.); πολίτας ταῖς φράτραις D.H. 2.55; τοὺς στρατιώτας εἰς τὴν σατραπείαν D.S. 19.44; αὐτοῖς . . τοὺς ἱππέας ἐπιδιῄρει divided and sent against them, App. Hisp. 25:— Med., of several, distribute among themselves, Hdt. 1.150, 5.116.

children.label: II
children.definition: make a cross-incision in, ὑμένα Gal. 12.522.
an after-course of dietetic, Dsc. 4.148.3.
control afterwards, Vett.Val. 246.21.
to be staked upon a throw at dice, used as Pass. of ἐπιδιατίθημι, Poll. 9.96.
to be laid upon, καλάμοις, of vegetables, Sor. 1.51.
share in oneʼs danger, J. AJ 14.14.3 (s.v.l.).
rinse out afterwards, Gal. 12.876 ( Med.).
render service, PStrassb. 5.11 (iii A.D.).
decide as umpire, Pl. Grg. 524a, prob. in Id. La. 184c.

children.label: II
children.definition: confirm a sentence, D.C. 57.20.

children.label: III
children.definition: estimate carefully, Vett.Val. 277.17.

children.label: IV
children.definition: f.l. in Aristid. Or. 26(14).30 ( ἔτι δ. cj. Reiske).
exact estimate, χρόνων Vett.Val. 37.10 (pl.).
allow to elapse, ὀλίγας ἡμέρας Alex.Trall. 1.17.
reconciliation, dub.l. in J. AJ 18.9.9 (pl.).
bring to reconciliation, J. AJ 16.6.8.
come as a relief to, c. acc., Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.8.5.
remain after, D.L. Prooem. 11, Dsc. 1.12, Artem. 1.45; continue to exist, Diog.Oen. 36.
continued existence, Stoic. 2.182, M.Ant. 4.21.
distribute, ἄρτους ἱερεῦσι Ph. 2.240; τινί τι J. BJ 2.6.3:— Pass., αἱ τρεῖς μναῖ ἐ. τῷ στατῆρι Arist. Ath. 10.2.

data.quote: αἱ τρεῖς μναῖ ἐ. τῷ στατῆρι

children.definition: think on, devise besides, Hp. Praec. 14.
send over besides, D.C. 60.20.
sail across after or besides, D.C. 47.47.
articulate further, Procl. Inst. 177, Ammon. in Int. 195.22, Prisc.Lyd. 36.8:—hence ἐπιδιάρθρ-ωσις, εως, ἡ, Dam. Pr. 431.
flow through or melt away besides, Erot. s.v. ἐπίδυεν.
burst at or because of a thing, Ar. Eq. 701.
declare further, Vett.Val. 87.20, al.; make more explicit, Hdn. Fig. p.95 S.:— Pass., become clearly understood, Plb. 32.16.5.
revise again, prepare a new edition of a work, Hp. Acut. 3.
consider further, D.C. Fr. 46.2 codd. (nisi leg. ἔτι δια-).
carry ridicule further, Sch. Ar. Pax 201.
subdivide further, Proll.Hermog. in Rh. 7.214 W.
make additions to a will, Ep.Gal. 3.15.
stretch by inflation yet further, Gal. 2.17.
spread far, of fame or rumour, Plb. 31.23.3; extend so as to include, ἐπί . . Phld. Rh. 2.209 S.

arrange besides or afterwards, D.C. 62.15:— Med., deposit as security for oneʼs doing a given act, Lys. Fr. 110 S.; ἀργύριον D. 33.13; cf. ἐπιδιαθήκη II; also, stake on a throw at dice, Poll. 9.96; cf. ἐπιδιάκειμαι.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., make a second or later will, Pap.Erzherzog Rainer 723 (ined., cf. Kreller Erbrechtl.Untersuch. p.298).
spend time on, χρόνον τῇ γεύσει Thphr. Od. 11; spend, ἡμέρας τρεῖς J. AJ 11.5.2, cf. Hdn. 2.11.1; ἐπιδιατρίψας dwelling on it, Arist. Mete. 371a23.
go across after, Th. 8.8 (v.l. διαφέρομαι).
destroy, ruin besides, in Pass., Ph. ap. Eus. PE 8.14; become corrupt, Gal. 8.42.
teach besides, X. Cyr. 1.3.17, Oec. 10.10, Sammelb. 5656.10 (vi A.D.).
epididymis, Gal. 4.565.
give besides, τινί τι Il. 23.559, Hdt. 2.121.δʹ, al., E. Med. 186 (anap.), Ba. 1128, etc.: abs., Hes. Op. 396, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: administer, ὅσων τῷ κάμνοντι δεῖ Ph. 1.253; give afterwards, τροφὴν προδόντες ἐπιδιδόασι τὸν ἐλλέβορον Dsc. 4.148.
give in dowry, ὅσσʼ οὔ πώ τις ἑῇ ἐπέδωκε θυγατρί Il. 9.148, cf. Lys. 16.10, Pl. Lg. 944a ( Pass.), X. Cyr. 8.5.19.

data.quote: ὅσσʼ οὔ πώ τις ἑῇ ἐπέδωκε θυγατρί

children.label: b
children.definition: contribute as a ‘benevolence’, for the purpose of supplying state necessities, opp. εἰσφέρειν (which was compulsory), Is. 5.37; ἐκ τῶν ἰδίων ἐ. Din. 1.80; τριήρη ἐπέδωκεν D. 21.160; ἐπέδωκα τὰ χρήματα Id. 18.113; τὸ κοινὸν ἐπέδωκε τῷ θεῷ SIG 489.9 ( Delph., iii B.C.); but also,

children.label: c
children.definition: offer money as a bribe or consideration, X. Ath. 3.3.
give freely, bestow, Th. 4.11, Ar. Pax 333; ὑμῖν τῶν ἑαυτοῦ τι Lys. 30.26; ἐ. τοῦ ἑαυτοῦ μέρους X. Cyr. 1.5.1; τὸν ἑαυτοῦ [ζῆλον] εἰς τὴν φιλοδοξίαν Inscr.Prien. 114.12 (i B.C.).

ἐπιδιδόναι ἑαυτόν give oneself up, devote oneself, τινί to one, Ar. Th. 213, cf. Luc. Peregr. 13; εἴς τι SIG 495.124 ( Olbia, iii B.C.), cf. Hdn. 3.4.1; εἰς πᾶν τό σοι χρήσιμον ἐμαυτὸν ἐ. UPZ 62.9 (ii B.C.); also (sc. ἑαυτὸν) ἐπιδιδόναι εἰς τρυφήν Ath. 12.525e; εἰς ὑπερηφανίαν Nymphis 15; ἐ. ἑαυτὸν τῇ πνεούσῃ Luc. Herm. 28: abs., ἐπιδόντες ἐφερόμεθα ran before the wind, Act. Ap. 27.15.

give into anotherʼs hands, deliver, ἐπιστολήν τινι D.S. 14.47 (dub.l.), Act.Ap. 15.30; χρηματισμόν LXX 2 Ma. 11.17; γραμματεῖον Luc. Peregr. 16: abs., of petitions, freq. in Pap., BGU 45, etc.; of reports or returns, POxy. 255.16 (i A.D.), etc.:— Pass., OGI 515.37 ( Mylasa, iii A.D.), Just. Nov. 53.3.1.
ἐ. ψῆφον τοῖς πολίταις give them power to vote, Plu. Num. 7.
dictate, opp. γράφειν, D.Chr. 18.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., take as oneʼs witness, θεοὺς ἐπιδώμεθα ‘ give each other our gods’, Il. 22.254:—in Il. 10.463, Aristarch. read σὲ γὰρ πρώτην . . ἐπιδωσόμεθʼ, perh. in the same sense, though Apollon. and Scholl. explain it by δώροις τιμήσομεν: cf. περιδίδωμι.

children.label: III
children.definition: increase, advance, ἐς ὕψος Hdt. 2.13; καθʼ ἡμέραν ἐς τὸ ἀγριώτερον Th. 6.60; ἐς τὸ μισεῖσθαι Id. 8.83; ἐπὶ τὸ μεῖζον ib. 24; ἐπὶ τὸ βέλτιον Hp. Aph. 1.3, Pl. Prt. 318a; εἰς ὄγκον πρὸς ἀρετήν increase in virtue Id. Lg. 913b; πρὸς εὐδαιμονίαν Isoc. 3.32: and abs., grow, Pl. Euthd. 271b; advance, improve, Th. 6.72, 7.8; βελτίων ἔσται καὶ ἐ. Pl. Prt. 318c, cf. Cra. 410e, Tht. 146b, 150d, Isoc. 9.68, etc.; ἐ. πάμπολυ [ἡ μάχη] waxes great, Pl. Tht. 179d.
give in, give way, ἐ. ἐπίδοσιν τοῖσι ἕλκουσι Hp. Art. 72, cf. Gal. 6.5, Sor. 1.103.
to be excreted afterwards, opp. προδιεξ-, Gal. 16.699.
pass along the line, σύνθημα Poll. 1.163.

definition: ἐπιδιευγάζω, dub. sens. in BGU 1143.16 (i B.C.).

children.definition: inquire besides, go on to inquire, Hdt. 1.95.
seek for or demand besides, Id. 5.106: so ἐπιδίζομαι Mosch. 2.28.
relate again, repeat, LXX Es. 1.17, Aristid. Or. 48 ( 24). 35.
after- or repeated narration, Arist. Rh. 1414b14, Corn. Rh. p.364H.
extend through, Sor. Fract. 2.
dilate, τὸ στόμα τῆς ὑστέρας Aspasia ap. Aët. 16.22.
let an interval elapse, σύμμετρον ἐπιδιαστήσαντες Philum. ap. Orib. 45.29.48.
Pass., ἐπιδιίσταμαι have a second diastole, of the pulse, Ruf. Syn.Puls. 8.7.
-αμένων τῶν βραχιόνων getting more separated, Sor. 2.62.

adjudge property in dispute to one, of the judge, ἐ. κλῆρόν τινι Is. 11.26, D. 48.26:— Pass., ἐπιδεδικασμένου καὶ ἔχοντος τὸν κλῆρον having had it adjudged to one and being in possession, Id. 43.7: abs., Lex ib. 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., of the claimant, go to law to establish oneʼs claim, Pl. Lg. 874a, PGnom. 28, 40 (ii A.D.); ἔχω . . τὸν κλῆρον ἐπιδικασάμενος I have obtained it by a lawsuit, Is. 11.19.

sue for, claim at law, ἐπιδικάζεσθαι τοῦ κλήρου Lys. Fr. 32, Is. 3.41, D. 43.3; ἐ. τῆς ἐπικλήρου claim the hand of the heiress, ib. 55, cf. And. 1.120, Is. 10.5; Ἐπιδικαζόμενος, ὁ, title of plays by Philem., Diph., and Apollod.; later ἐ. τῆς ἀρχῆς J. AJ 19.2.1: metaph., ἐ. τῆς μέσης χώρας Arist. EN 1107b31:— Pass., to be assigned, of an heiress, D.S. 12.18.
process at law to obtain an inheritance, Is. 3.41, 61 (pl.), Lex ap. D. 43.16, Ph. 2.443; τῆς θυγατρός for her hand as heiress, Is. 3.72.
to be claimed as oneʼs right, J. AJ 4.2.4; much sought for, Luc. Somn. 9.
those to whom property is adjudged, IG 5(2).159.6 ( Tegea, v B.C.).
throw upon, δίκον φύλλʼ ἔπι Pi. P. 9.124.
render justice, τινί Schwyzer 366 A 23 ( Tolophon, iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Mon.Ant. 23.85 ( Adalia).

disputed at law, liable to be made the subject of a process at law (cf. ἀνεπίδικος), ἐ. τινί ἐστιν ὁ κλῆρος Is. 3.3, 43, cf. 11.10; μὴ ἐ. εἶναι τὸν κλῆρον D. 44.46. Adv. -κως, ἀνυέσθω Petos. ap. Vett.Val. 128.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἐπίδικος, ἡ, an heiress for whose hand her next of kin are claimants at law, Is. 3.64; ἐ. τινα καταλιπεῖν ib. 73.

subject to a judicial decision, δίδωμι ἐμαυτὸν ἐπίδικον τοῖς δημόταις I commit myself to the peopleʼs decision, D.H. 7.58 codd.; disputed, of territory, πρός τινας Plu. Cleom. 4; ἐ. νίκη a disputed victory, Id. Fab. 3.
containing 1 2/3, Nicom. Ar. 1.20, al.

definition: ἐπιδινεύω, later form for sq., Opp. H. 4.218, Hld. 3.3.

children.definition: whirl for the throw, swing round before throwing, ῥῖψʼ ἐπιδινήσας Il. 3.378, cf. Od. 9.538, etc.:— Med., turn over in oneʼs mind, resolve, ἐμοὶ τόδε θυμὸς πόλλʼ ἐπιδινεῖται 20.218:— Pass., wheel about, as birds in the air, 2.151; Σιληνοὶ . . ὄθμασι δινήθησαν ἔπι Nic. Al. 33; so ἐπιδινεῖν αὑτούς, of drones, Arist. HA 624a24.
swelling up, Sor. 1.48 (pl.), 2.31.
inf. -δίεθθαι, part. -διόμενος GDI 4998 ( Gortyn).

correct afterwards, GDI 5039.9 ( Hierapytna, ii B.C.): — Med., ἐ. τὰ λείποντα to have deficiencies set right also, complete unfinished reforms, Ep.Tit. 1.5; simply, correct, Syrian. in Metaph. 167.11.
correction of a previous expression, Hermog. Id. 2.7, Tib. Fig. 9.
excusing of an unpleasant statement (opp. προ-, q.v.), Alex. Fig. 1.4, Longin. Rh. p.194 H.
correction, Eustr. in APο. 173.27.
corrective, Hermog. Id. 2.4, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 454.3. Adv. -κῶς Sch. Ar. Pl. 493.
define or determine further, Arist. Cael. 303a13, Gal. 7.706, al.
one must define further, Arist. Top. 149a31.
pass along with the urine, Hp. Prorrh. 2.4.
make double, σιτηρέσια v.l. in Hdn. 6.8.8:— Pass., J. AJ 19.1.5.
redouble: prob. f.l. for ἐπανδιπλάζω, A. Eu. 1014 codd. (lyr.).
make double, τὴν δέρριν LXX Ex. 26.9; ἐ. τὰ φύλλα fold them double, Peripl.M.Rubr. 65.
multiply by two, Paul.Al. H. 4:— Pass., Vett.Val. 223.34.
redoubling, double fold, Ph. 2.479 (pl.).
throw away: hence, discard, in Pass., prob. in Phld. Herc. 1251.17.
doubt about a thing, Thphr. Od. 45; περί τινος Porph. Marc. 19.
ambiguity, v.l. in Gal. 6.136.
containing 1 2/3, Nicom. Ar. 1.21.
breastwork of a chariot, Il. 10.475.
on the car, εἰς ὅ κε δῶρα φέρων ἐπιδίφρια θήῃ Od. 15.51, cf. 75.

data.quote: εἰς ὅ κε δῶρα φέρων ἐπιδίφρια θήῃ

children.label: II
children.definition: one who sits at his work, plies a sedentary or humble trade, D.H. Th. 50, PLond. 5.1708.21 (vi A.D.), Just. Nov. 90.1 Intr.; ἐ. τεχνίτης Iamb. VP 34.245; τέχνη ἐ. a sedentary trade, D.H. 2.28; ἐργασία Artem. 2.14.
Adj., belonging to daily life, λέξις, opp. πολιτική, δημηγορική, Phld. Rh. 1.199S.

definition: ἐπίδιχα σκύφον τὸν μὴ κενόν, Hsch.

children.definition: Nic. Th. 436.
continued pursuit, ἐναντίων Plb. 11.18.7.
pursuer, Gloss.
pursue after, τινά Hdt. 4.1, 160, Lys. 3.35, etc.; seek for, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.103.

children.label: II
children.definition: prosecute again, Is. Fr. 157.

children.label: III
children.definition: recite afterwards, PMag.Leid.V. 11.16.
entertain doubts over, turn over and over, πολέας ἐπεδοίασα βουλάς A.R. 3.21; cf. δοιάζω, ἐνδοιάζω.

definition: ἐπίδοκα προσδοκία, Hsch. ἐπιδοκέω, f.l. in And. 4.29. ἐπιδοκίδες· προσδοκίαι, Hsch.

children.definition: contribution to a feast, Ath. 8.364f (pl.).
sound or rattle atop, Antiph. 185.
form an opinion about a thing:— Pass., ἐπιδοξαζόμενον matter of opinion, Thphr. CP 1.5.5.

likely, of persons, ἐ. γενέσθαι ἐπιεικεῖς likely to turn out well, Pl. Tht. 143d; ἐ. τοῦτο πείσεσθαι in danger of suffering . . , Hdt. 6.12; ἐ. ὢν πάσχειν Antipho 2.1.5, cf. 2.4.9; ἐ. ὢν τυχεῖν being expected to gain . . , Isoc. 6.8; τοὺς ἐ. γενήσεσθαι πονηρούς Id. 20.12; ἐπιδοξοτέρου ὄντος (sc. αἱρεθῆναι) App. BC 1.32: sts. c. fut. part., ἐ. ἦσαν ἐμβαλοῦντες Plu. Agis 13; of things, ἐ. ἡ ἀπόστασις παρασχίδων ὀστέων ἀπιέναι Hp. Fract. 24; ἐ. γενέσθαι Hdt. 1.89; πρὸς οὓς ἐ. [ἐστι] πολεμεῖν Arist. Rh. 1359b39: abs., ὅσα . . κακὰ ἐπίδοξα καταλαμβάνειν ( -λαμβάνει codd.) Hdt. 4.11.

data.quote: ἐ. ἡ ἀπόστασις παρασχίδων ὀστέων ἀπιέναι

children.label: II
children.definition: glorious, κῦδος Pi. N. 9.46; and in late Prose, as LXX Si. 3.18, D.S. 13.83, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.239d, etc. Adv. -ξως LXX 1 Es. 9.45, IG 12(7).117, 288 ( Amorgos), Artem. 2.30.
glory, Aq. Za. 6.13, al.
tip, point of a lance, spear-head, Demad. 20, Plb. 6.25.5, al., Corn. ND 30, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.217e.

children.label: III
children.definition: spear-shaft, gloss on χάρμη, Sch. Pi. Dith.Oxy. 3.13.

children.label: IV
children.definition: dewlap, Gloss. (nisi leg. ἐπιδορά τις vel ἐπιδορίς).
second course: hence, of a small offering, Herod. 4.13.
AP 6.299 ( Phan.).
eat in the second course or for dessert, τι Diph. 79, Sophil. 4.5: in Poll. 6.102 ἐπιδορπήσασθαι is f.l. for -ίσασθαι, cf. ib. 79.
for use after dinner, ὕδωρ (cf. προσδόρπιος) Theoc. 13.36; for dessert, τράπεζαι Ath. l.c.; also τεῦχος ἐ., of the stomach, Nic. Al. 21.

definition: ἐπιδορπίς, ίδος, ἡ, old name for δεῖπνον, Philem. ap. Ath. 1.11d.

children.definition: second course, dessert, Philippid. 20 (pl.), Com.Adesp. 141 (pl.), Ath. 14.664f.
dessert, Arist. Fr. 104.
given over and above, ἐ. παρὰ τἆλλα τοῦτʼ ἔσται Alex. 65; ἐ. [δεῖπνα] to which unexpected luxuries have been added, Crobyl. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: contributed freely, τριήρης IG 2(2).1629.960, cf. 950, Inscr.Prien. 112.100 (i B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐπιδόσιμον, τό, return handed in, PLond. 1.131r. 348.
ἐπιδόσιμος (sc. λόγος), ὁ, section of a document, PRyl. 233.11 (ii A.D.).
free giving, ἐν ἐπιδόσει καὶ χάριτι τὴν ἀλλαγὴν ποιοῦνται τούτων Plb. 34.8.10.

data.quote: ἐν ἐπιδόσει καὶ χάριτι τὴν ἀλλαγὴν ποιοῦνται τούτων

children.label: II
children.definition: free gift, esp. voluntary contribution to the state, ‘ benevolence’, benefaction, οἱ τὰς μεγάλας ἐπιδόσεις ἐπιδόντες D. 18.171; ἐγένοντʼ εἰς Εὔβοιαν ἐπιδόσεις παρʼ ὑμῖν πρῶται κτλ. Id. 21.161, cf. Thphr. Char. 22.3; ἐπιδόσεις πεποιῆσθαί τισι Histria 7.23 (i B.C.); charitable endowment, POxy. 705.59 (iii A.D.).
largess given to soldiers, Lat. donativum, Hdn. 1.5.1, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: handing in of a petition, return, etc., BGU 1193.11 (i B.C.), etc.

children.label: IV
children.definition: increase, advance, progress, ἐ. ἐς πλῆθος τοῦ ῥυφήματος Hp. Acut. 12; progress of disease, Gal. 1.198; ἐ. ἔχειν to be capable of progress or improvement, Pl. Tht. 146b, Smp. 175e, cf. Plb. 1.20.2; ἐ. λαμβάνειν πρός τι Isoc. 15.267, cf. Arist. Cat. 10b28; ἐ. ποιῆσαι τοῖς πράγμασι Plb. 1.36.2; ἡ ἐ. γίγνεται πρός τι Arist. EN 1109a17; τῶν τεχνῶν αἱ ἐ. ib. 1098a25; ἡ τρίτη ἐ. τῆς ὀλιγαρχίας stage, Id. Pol. 1293a27.

children.label: b
children.definition: devotion, addiction, τινός to a thing, D.H. Comp. 4 codd.; ἐ. μὲν εἰς τιμὴν πλούτου . . , ὀλιγωρία δὲ τῶν καλῶν Gal. 10.172.

data.quote: ἐ. μὲν εἰς τιμὴν πλούτου . . , ὀλιγωρία δὲ τῶν καλῶν

children.definition: giving way, relaxation, of sinews, Hp. Art. 8 (pl.); ἐ. ἐπιδοῦναι ib. 72.
ἐ. αὑτοῦ self -surrender, Plot. 6.9.11.
giver of more, τέκνων, opp. ἀφαιρέτης, of planets, Ptol. Tetr. 189.
ready to give to those who need, distd. from μεταδοτικός by Ammon. Diff. p.56V.

children.label: II
children.definition: ready to give way, Hp. Mochl. 41.
to be a slave, παρά τινι Jul. Ep. 198.
make a noise or clashing, ταῖς σαρίσαις Plu. Eum. 14; ἠχείοις Id. Crass. 23.
reception in addition, πολιτῶν Th. 6.17 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: undertaking, POxy. 102.18, 103.16 (iv A.D.).
offerings plucked, πυρῶν καὶ καρπῶν Orac. in App.Anth. p.602 ( Tralles).

lay hold of, τινός Plu. Alex. 25, Gal. 4.537, etc.; τι Alciphr. 3.60: metaph., τινός Phld. Rh. 2.266S.; ἀληθείας Jul. Or. 6.188c; παντὸς πολιτεύματος Plu. An seni 2.793c; τὸ ἀκόλαστον ἐ. τινός Id. Oth. 2.
perform over a person, of purificatory rites, τινί τι Philostr. VA 6.5.
pluck, σταφυλήν Hp. Mul. 1.105.
Orph. A. 561, H. 21.5; rapidly, Nic. Th. 481; cursorily, ἱστορῆσαι Str. 2.1.6.
ἐνι- in Max. 282.
running over, inroad, κυμάτων Arist. Mu. 400a26 (pl.); onward motion, IGRom. 4.503.34 (Pergam.).

brief notice, Phld. Rh. 2.268S.; ἐν τῇ ἐ. τῶν φιλοσόφων in his summary notice of them, D.L. 7.48; summary, προειρημένων λόγων Corn. Rh. p.389H.; ἀποδείξεων Dam. Pr. 369; ἐπιτομὰς ἢ συνάψεις ἢ ἐπιδρομάς Gal. 9.431; ὡς ἐν ἐπιδρομῇ δεδείχθω Iamb. in Nic. p.72P.

children.label: II
children.definition: inroad, raid, attack, Th. 4.34, 56; τῷ τειχίσματι ib. 23; ἐξ ἐπιδρομῆς ἁρπαγή plundering by means of an inroad, Hdt. 1.6: hence ἐξ ἐπιδρομῆς on the spur of the moment, ἐξ ἐ. αἱρέσεις ποιεῖσθαι Pl. R. 619d; εἰπεῖν Plu. Ant. 80, cf. Men. Pk. 148; cursorily, μνήμην ποιήσασθαι φαύλως καὶ ἐξ ἐ. D.H. Pomp. 3 (so κατʼ ἐπιδρομήν Aps. Rh. p.258H.); μηδὲν ἐξ ἐ. παθεῖν by a sudden attack, D. 21.138, cf. D.H. 2.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: office of inspector, τῆς μητροπόλεως PFay. 23.2 (ii A.D.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: a place to which ships run in, landing-place, Λιβύης . . ἐρήμους ἀξένους τʼ ἐπιδρομάς E. Hel. 404; πλοῦν οὔριον . . Ἰλίου τʼ ἐπιδρομάς Id. IA 1597; τὰς ἐ. τῆς θαλάσσης διαχῶσαι Phalar. Ep. 62.

children.label: V
children.definition: flow of blood (to an atrophied part), Hp. Off. 24.
assault, A.R. 3.593 (pl.).
hasty, cursory, summary, S.E. M. 5.3 ( Comp.).
pulley, Gloss.

that may be overrun, τεῖχος ἐ. a wall that may be scaled, Il. 6.434 (but τεῖχος ἅρμασιν ἐ. on which chariots can run, AP 9.58 ( Antip.(?))); ἐ. Ζεφύροισι overrun by the W. winds, ib. 10.13 ( Satyr.), cf. Opp. H. 3.635; νηυσὶν ἐ. ἐστι θάλασσα Mosch. 2.137; τὰ ἐ. καὶ ταπεινά, of countries, Plu. Eum. 9.
intelligible, τοῖς ἀμυήτοις Them. Or. 13.162c.
fatally easy, πρᾶγμα Just. Nov. 72.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., running over, spreading, of sores, Nic. Th. 242.
over-hasty, rash, γνώμη, ὅρκος, Paus. 9.21.6, 33.3.
following freely or easily, A. Supp. 124 (lyr.); τὸ σὸν κατὰ χειρὸς ἐ. καὶ λεῖον Luc. Dem.Enc. 10.

children.label: III
children.definition: Subst. ἐπίδρομος, ὁ, cord which runs along the upper edge of a net, X. Cyn. 6.9, Poll. 5.29, cf. Plin. HN 19.11; so διʼ ὀργάνων ἐπιδρόμων (prob.) by running ropes, Plu. Sert. 22.
a small sail at the stern, like the mizzen-sail of a yawl (or, acc. to Poll. 1.91, the mast of such a sail), Isid. Etym. 19.3.3.
catching the dew, prob. cj. in Thphr. HP 7.14.1.
give an ill name to, τινά Arist. EN 1145a33.
set upon or so as to interrupt an action, μὴ πρὶν ἐπʼ ἠέλιον δῦναι Il. 2.413; ὁ ἥλιος μὴ ἐ. ἐπὶ τῷ παροργισμῷ ὑμῶν Ep.Eph. 4.26, cf. LXX De. 24.15, Ph. 2.324.

data.quote: ὁ ἥλιος μὴ ἐ. ἐπὶ τῷ παροργισμῷ ὑμῶν

children.definition: build upon, pf. Pass. ἐπιδεδώμηται Ph.Byz. Mir. 4.4: written ἐπιδεδομ- ib. 2.3 (teste Bast Ep.Crit. p.45); cf. δωμάω, ἐνδώμησις.
give besides, Gal. 14.305.
the Bountiful, epith. of gods, esp. Zeus at Mantinea, Paus. 8.9.2, cf. Plu. Suav. 2.1102e:—hence Ἐπιδώτειον, τό, temple at Epidaurus, IG 4.1492.24.
of 8:7, Ptol. Harm. 1.15.

definition: ἐπιεθανίς λεπτὸν πρόβατον, Hsch. post ἐπηετα(ν)ῶν.

children.definition: reasonableness, ἔχει τινὰ οὗτος ὁ λόγος ἐπιείκειαν Hp. Fract. 31.

data.quote: ἔχει τινὰ οὗτος ὁ λόγος ἐπιείκειαν

children.definition: equity, opp. strict law, Arist. Top. 141a16, etc.; κατʼ ἐπιείκειαν, opp. κατὰ τοὺς ὅρκους, Isoc. 18.34; ἄκαμπτον εἰς ἐ. Plu. Cat.Mi. 4.

reasonableness, fairness, Th. 3.40, 48, 5.86, Pl. Lg. 735a, etc.; ἐ. καὶ πρᾳότης Plu. Per. 39, cf. 2 Ep.Cor. 10.1; also, goodness, virtuousness, Lys. 16.11, D. 21.207, Arist. EN 1175b24: pl., joined with χάριτες, Isoc. 4.63, cf. 15.149.

children.label: II
children.definition: Clemency, Plu. Caes. 57.
like, τινί, the masc. freq. in Hom. (esp. in Il.), but only in phrases ἐ. ἀθανάτοισιν, θεοῖς ἐ., Il. 1.[265], 4.394, Od. 24.36, etc.; so θεοῖς ἐπιείκελα τέκνα Hes. Th. 968.
to be ἐπιεικής, LXX 2 Es. 9.8 (cod.A, cf. Hsch.).

fitting, meet, suitable, τύμβον οὐ μάλα πολλὸν . . , ἀλλʼ ἐπιεικέα τοῖον not very large but meet in size, Il. 23.246; τείσουσι βοῶν ἐπιεικέʼ ἀμοιβήν a fair recompense for them, Od. 12.382.—Elsewh. Hom. has only the neut. ἐπιεικές, either in the phrase ὡς ἐπιεικές as is meet, Il. 19.147, 23.537, Od. 8.389: or c. inf., ὅν κʼ ἐπιεικὲς ἀκουέμεν whom it may be meet for you to hear, Il. 1.547; ὅπλα . . οἷʼ ἐπιεικὲς ἔργʼ ἔμεν ἀθανάτων such as is meet they should be, 19.21, cf. 23.50, Od. 2.207.

ὅπλα . . οἷʼ ἐπιεικὲς ἔργʼ ἔμεν ἀθανάτων such as is

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom.,

children.label: a
children.definition: reasonable, specious, ἡ δὲ τρίτη τῶν ὁδῶν πολλὸν ἐπιεικεστάτη ἐοῦσα μάλιστα ἔψευσται Hdt. 2.22; ἐ. πρόφασις Th. 3.9; λόγος Pl. Ti. 67d; ἐπιεικῆ λέγειν Id. Ap. 34d; ἐ. ὁδός a tolerable road, Plu. Crass. 22.

data.quote: ἡ δὲ τρίτη τῶν ὁδῶν πολλὸν ἐπιεικεστάτη ἐοῦσα μάλιστα ἔψευσται

children.label: b
children.definition: δίκαιος, fair, equitable, not according to the letter of the law, ἐπανόρθωμα νομίμου δικαίου Arist. EN 1137b11, cf. Rh. 1374a26; τῶν δικαίων τὰ ἐπιεικέστερα προτιθεῖσι Hdt. 3.53; οὔτε τοὐπ. οὔτε τὴν χάριν οἶδεν, μόνην δʼ ἔστερξε τὴν ἁπλῶς δίκην S. Fr. 770, cf. E. Fr. 645; συγχωρεῖν τἀπιεικῆ τινι Ar. Nu. 1438; ἐπιεικέστερον ἢ δικαιότερον Antipho 2.2.13; ἐ. ὁμολογία Th. 3.4; γνώμη Ar. V. 1027; τὸ ἐ. καὶ σύγγνωμον Pl. Lg. 757e; πρὸς τὸ ἐ., = ἐπιεικῶς 3, Th. 4.19.

data.quote: οὔτε τοὐπ. οὔτε τὴν χάριν οἶδεν, μόνην δʼ ἔστερξε τὴν ἁπλῶς δίκην

children.definition: able, capable, παῖς τὰ μὲν ἄλλα ἐ., ἄφωνος δέ Hdt. 1.85; οἱ ἐπιεικέστατοι τῶν τριηράρχων X. HG 1.1.30; τίνες . . τῶν νέων ἐπίδοξοι γενέσθαι ἐ. may be expected to turn out well, Pl. Tht. 143d, cf. Lg. 957a; τοὺς ἐ. καὶ τοῦ δήμου καὶ τῶν εὐπόρων Arist. Ath. 26.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: reasonable, fair, good, ἐ. τὴν ψυχήν, φύσει, Pl. Smp. 210b, R. 538c: abs., Th. 8.93, Isoc. 1.48, Ep.Jac. 3.17, etc.; ἐ. ἄνδρες, opp. μοχθηροί, Arist. Po. 1452b34; ἐ. περὶ τὰ συμβόλαια D. 34.30; τοὐπιεικές fairness, goodness, S. OC 1127.

children.label: c
children.definition: upper or educated classes, λέγω ἀντικεῖσθαι τοὺς ἐ. τῷ πλήθει Arist. Pol. 1308b27, cf. Ath. 28.1.

data.quote: λέγω ἀντικεῖσθαι τοὺς ἐ. τῷ πλήθει

children.definition: Adv. -κῶς, Ion. -κέως, fairly, tolerably, moderately, ἐγγλύσσει ἐ. Hdt. 2.92; ἐ. δάκνειν, παρρησίαν ἄγειν, Phld. Lib. pp. 13,45 O.; ἐ. ἔχειν to be pretty well, Hp. Coac. 368; ἐ. ἐξεπίστασθαι Ar. V. 1249; ἔστι τὸ χωρίον ἐ. ἰσχυρόν Hell.Oxy. 13.5; ἐ. ἀναίσθητον Arist. GC 319b20; ἐ. πλατύ Id. HA 495b27, cf. 497a23; οἱ πυρετοὶ ἐς τεταρταῖον ἐ. μεθίστανται about the fourth day, Hp. Coac. 140, cf. Alex. 281; ἐ. τὸ τρίτον μέρος pretty nearly, about, Plb. 6.26.8; ἐ. οἷοί τε ἦσαν κατέχειν were fairly well able . . , Pl. Phd. 117c; ἐ. μὲν . . perhaps, Id. Grg. 493c.

ἐ. οἷοί τε ἦσαν κατέχειν were

with moderation, mildly, kindly, οὐκ ἐ. ἐντυγχάνων οὐδὲ πρᾴως Plu. Pyrrh. 23; ἐ. ἔχειν πρός τινα Isoc. 15.4: Comp. -έστερον, διακείμενοι Id. 8.61.
generally, usually, Plu. Pel. 18, Jul. Mis. 348c, Lib. Or. 11.19, al.
ratio of 28:27, Ptol. Harm. 1.13.
ratio of 22:21, Ptol. Harm. 2.1.

ratio of 24:23, Ptol. Harm. 1.15.

yielding, Ep. word, in Hom. always with neg., σθένος οὐκ ἐ. unyielding, dauntless might, Il. 8.32; μένος ἔμπεδον οὐδʼ ἐ. Od. 19.493; μένος . . ἀάσχετον, οὐκ ἐ. Il. 5.892; πένθος ἄσχετον, οὐκ ἐ. ceaseless, 16.549.
ἔργα γελαστὰ καὶ οὐκ ἐπιεικτά not tolerable, Od. 8.307; ὀστέον οὐκ ἐ. Opp. H. 1.526.
permissible, οὐκ ἐπιεικτὰ ζητῶν Anon. Incred. 15(14) = Luc. Astr. 15: c. dat., befitting, βροτοῖσιν Man. 6.402.

definition: ἐπιείσομαι, ἐπιεισάμενος, only fut. and aor.,

ratio of 7:6, Ptol. Harm. 1.15.
desire, ἐνισπεῖν A.R. 4.783.
one who rolls round, coined to explain the Homeric ἠλέκτωρ, Sch. Il. 19.398.
to be hoped or expected, Archil. 74.5, Opp. H. 4.311.
ratio of 10:9, Ptol. Harm. 1.15.
of 12:11, Ptol. Harm. 2.14.

put on besides or over, χλαῖναν δʼ ἐπιέσσαμεν we threw a cloak over him, Od. 20.143: elsewh. Hom. has only pf. part. Pass. ἐπιειμένος ( Aeol. ἐπέμμενος Sapph. 70): in metaph. sense c. acc., ἀναιδείην, ἀλκήν, clad in shamelessness, strength, Il. 1.149, 8.262, etc.; ἐ. ἀχλύν AP 7.283 ( Leon.); λευκοῖσι κόμας ἐ. ὤμοις covered with hair over her white shoulders, A.R. 3.45; χαλκὸν ἐπίεσται has brass upon or over it, Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.47:— Med., put on oneself besides, put on as an upper garment, χλαίνας ἐπείνυσθαι Hdt. 4.64: metaph., ἐπὶ δὲ νεφέλην ἕσσαντο Il. 14.350; γᾶν ἐπιεσσόμενος ( fut.), i.e. to be buried. Pi. N. 11.16; so γῆν ἐπιέσασθαι X. Cyr. 6.4.6; γῆν ἐπιεννύμεθα AP 7.480 ( Leon.), cf. Theoc. Ep. 9.4: also, c. acc. rei, ἐπιεσσάμενοι νῶτον κρόκαις having wrapt oneʼs shoulders with it, Pi. N. 10.44.— Old Ep. Verb, not found till late (exc. Sapph. l.c.) in the form ἐφέννῡμι, because of the digamma, v. ἕννυμι, καταέννυμι; ἐπιέσασθαι is retained even in X. l.c.; ἐφέσσεσθαι, ἐφέσσατο, A.R. 1.691, 1326; ἐφεσσάμενος Theoc. l.c., AP 7.299 ( Nicom.), 446 ( Hegesipp.).
of 65: 64, Ptol. Harm. 1.11.
of 18: 17, Ptol. Harm. 1.10.
annual college of magistrates, IG 5(2).6.61 ( Tegea, iv B.C.).
of this year, ἀγών SIG 690 ( Delph., ii B.C.); χιών v.l. in Plb. 3.55.1.
ἐπιϝοικία, ἐπίϝοικος, v. ἐποικία, ἔποικος. ἔπιζα· ὄρνεα (Cypr.), Hsch. ἐπιζάνω, Ion. for ἐφιζάνω. ἐπιζάξ· ἐπὶ τὰ ἀριστερὰ καὶ ἐπʼ εὐθείας, Hsch. (with other expll., cf. ἐπιτάξ).
E. Rh. 441 (prob., -ζάτει codd.), Ph. 45: said to be Arc. by Eust. 909.28.

vehement, violent, χόλος Il. 9.525. Adv. -λῶς (as if from ἐπιζαφελής, which never occurs, v. Eust. 769.22) vehemently, furiously, ἐ. χαλεπαίνειν, μενεαίνειν, Il. 9.516, Od. 6.330; ἐρεείνειν h.Merc. 487: also neut. as Adv., ἐπιζάφελον κοτέουσα A.R. 4.1672.
survive, εἰ ἐπέζωσε Hdt. 1.120; ἂν ὡς ὀλίγιστον χρόνον ἐπιζώῃ Pl. Lg. 661c ( -ζώιη cod.), cf. Eus.Mynd. 38, etc.: metaph. of envy, Plu. Num. 22.

definition: ἐπιζείω, poet. for ἐπιζέω, Orph. A. 459.

children.definition: boiling or boiled liquid, Sm. Ho. 10.7.
boil in, οἴνῳ Gal. 13.319 ( Pass.).
join at top, Hdt. 7.36; τοὺς κίονας τοῖς ἐπι στυλίοις Plu. Per. 13; τοὺς δακτύλους τῆς ἑτέρας χειρὸς ἐπὶ τὴν ἑτέραν ἐ. Arist. Pr. 912b14; simply, bind fast, χεῖρας ἱμᾶσι Theoc. 22.3.

join to, πώλοις . . τόνδʼ ἐπιζεύξασʼ ὄχον A. Eu. 405: metaph., ἐπέζευκται κοινὸν ὄνομά [τινι καί τινι] Arist. HA 531b22, cf. Rh. 1407b19; θνητὸν βίον ἀθανάτῳ ἐ. Ph. 1.209; μηδʼ ἐπιζευχθῇς στόμα φήμῃ πονηρᾷ nor let thy mouth be joined to evil sayings, A. Ch. 1044: Math., ἐπεζεύχθω ἀπὸ κτλ. let the point A be joined to the point B, Arist. Mete. 376a17.

children.label: II
children.definition: enclose, join up, of hills, Plb. 1.75.4, 3.49.7.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐπεζευγμένον, τό, minor premise of a disjunctive syllogism, Chrysipp. ap. S.E. P. 2.158.
strap, trace, Hsch.
connective, [ σύνδεσμος] A.D. Synt. 272.3, cf. Sch. A.R. 1.1349.
fastening together, joining, Thphr. HP 2.6.1, prob. for ἐπίδεσις in Paul.Aeg. 6.97.

children.label: II
children.definition: repetition of a word, Hdn. Fig. p.99 S., Phoeb. Fig. 1.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: addition, τοῦ τόπου A.D. Synt. 336.10, cf. Ptol. Tetr. 1.
towards the west, western, Euph. 121: the Italian Locrians were called Ἐπιζεφύριοι, Hdt. 6.23, etc., f.l. in Pi. O. 10.13.

boil over, πυρὸς καὶ κλύδωνος ἐπιζέσαντος Plu. Pyth. 2.399d; bubble up, πομφόλυγες -ζέουσαι Arr. in Stob. App. p.9G.; effervesce, Dsc. 5.74: metaph., ἀκούσαντί μοι ἡ νεότης ἐπέζεσε my youthful spirit boiled over when I heard, Hdt. 7.13; οὐ θαυμάσιον ἐπιζεῖν τὴν χολήν Ar. Th. 468; θυμάλωψ ἐπέζεσεν (as if he had said θυμός) Id. Ach. 321; κέντρʼ ἐπιζέσαντα of the poison working out of the skin, S. Tr. 840 (lyr.): c. dat., δεινόν τι πῆμα Πριαμίδαις ἐπέζεσεν E. Hec. 583.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., cause to boil, heat, c. acc., ἐπιζεῖν λέβητα πυρί Id. Cyc. 392: me taph., δεινή τις ὀργὴ δαιμόνων ἐπέζεσε τὸ Ταντάλειον σπέρμα Id. IT 987.

data.quote: δεινή τις ὀργὴ δαιμόνων ἐπέζεσε τὸ Ταντάλειον σπέρμα

children.definition: enviable, happy, τύχα B. 5.52, cf. A. Ag. 939, Ptol. Tetr. 186: written ἐπίδηλα in TAM 2(1).245.12 ( Lycia).

definition: ἐπιζήμιος, Dor. etc. ἐπιζάμιος [ ᾱ], ον,

children.definition: bringing loss upon, hurtful, prejudicial, Charon 12, Th. 1.32, Isoc. 2.18, etc.; τινί X. Mem. 2.7.9, cf. Aeschin. 1.45. Adv. -ίως Poll. 8.147, D.Chr. 14.18.

penal: ἐπιζήμια, τά, punishments, penalties, Pl. Lg. 784e, 788b; -ζάμια Tab. Heracl. 1.127; χρησόμεθα ἐπιζημίοις, = ἐπιζημιώσομεν, Epist.Philipp. ap. D. 18.157: sg., -ζάμιον, τό, fine, IG 5(2).6.36 ( Tegea), 5(1).1498 ( Messenia).

children.label: II
children.definition: liable to punishment, of persons, Pl. Lg. 765a; of acts, Arist. Pol. 1297a33, cf. PRev.Laws 7.6 (iii B.C.).
mulct, στατῆρι κατὰ τὸν ἄνδρα τῆς ἡμέρας X. HG 5.2.22.

data.quote: στατῆρι κατὰ τὸν ἄνδρα τῆς ἡμέρας

children.definition: penalty, Tab. Heracl. 1.155, Poll. 8.149.
infliction of penalties, Arist. Ath. 45.1 (pl.).

seek after, wish for, miss, τινά Hdt. 3.36, Plu. Sull. 19; οὐδὲν ἄλλο χρῆμα οὕτω ἐν βραχέϊ ἐπεζήτησα ὡς . . Hdt. 5.24; μηδὲν ἐπιζητείτω let her lack nothing, PTeb. 416.20 (iii A.D.); ἐ. τὸν ἄνθρωπον make further search for . . , D. 18.133; τῆς αἰτίας αἰτίαν ἐπι ζητούσης requiring, Plb. 1.5.3, cf. Ph. 1.18: abs., οἱ ἐπιζητοῦντες the beaters (for game), X. Cyr. 2.4.25:— Pass., τὰ ἐπιζητούμενα περὶ τὴν εὐδαιμονίαν Arist. EN 1098b22, cf. 1172b35, Diog.Oen. 23; οἱ -ούμενοι criminals ‘ wanted’, POxy. 80.15 (iii A.D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: request, πρός τινας ὁμολογίαν Anatolian Studies 38, cf. PMasp. 156.16 (vi A.D.).

Pass., ἐπιζητεῖται is matter of question, ἐ. πότερον . . Arist. EN 1169b13, cf. Phld. D. 1.22, Rh. 1.194S., al.
demand, require, PLille 7.6 (iii B.C.):— Pass., POxy. 1194.2 (iii A.D.).
requirement, demand, Phld. D. 1.16 (pl.); τὰ φυσικὰ ἐ. Id. Oec. p.14J.

seeking after, craving, X.Eph. 2.12; τροφῆς Gal. 19.372; δεινὴ τἀνδρὸς ἐ. ἦν he was sorely missed, J. AJ 13.6.3, cf. 4.8.3; desire, craving (for drink), Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.30.4: in pl., cravings, Id. in Rh.Mus. 58.87.
inquiry, PSI 4.386.40 (iii B.C.), Phld. Sign. 21, 28 (pl.), J. Ap. 1.22, Iamb. Myst. 1.18.
rendering of account for examination, ἐ. πρός τινας θέσθαι PLond. 5.1708.158 (vi A.D.).
to be looked for, required, Arist. EN 1094b13; to be sought for, Chor. in Rh.Mus. 49.502.
apt to crave or miss, τῶν κενώσεων -κὸν γίγνεσθαι τὸ σῶμα Erasistr. (?) ap. Gal. Consuet. 5.
interrogative, σύνδεσμος Suid. s.v. μῶν.
to be joined, Nic. Fr. 74.22.
IG 5(2).3.13 ( Tegea, iv B.C.).

iron pin upon which the strands of the torsion engine were wound, Ph. Bel. 53.27, Hero Bel. 83.5.

definition: ἐπιζυγκλεῖν ἐπισκαρδαμύττειν, ἐπιστένειν, ἐπικατακλᾶν, and ἐπιζυγκ<λ>-οῦσα· ἐπικλείουσα, μύουσα, Hsch.
ἐπίζυγος, ον, of tiles, dub. sens. in Inscr.Délos 366 A 21,23.

over-girth, Gloss.

girdle, S. Fr. 342.

definition: ἐπιζώω, Ion. for ἐπιζάω (q.v.). ἐπίηλε [ῑ], v. ἐπιάλλω. ἐπιήνδανε, v. ἐφανδάνω.

Rhian. 1.21; ἐπίηρα φέρεσθαι A.R. 4.375; δέχθαι AP 13.22 ( Phaedim.); ἐπίηρα, as Adv., = χάριν, for the sake of, Antim. 87; ὃς κακὰ πόλλʼ ὑπέμεινε μιῆς ἐ. θυγατρός PHamb. 22.2 (iv A.D.).

data.quote: ὃς κακὰ πόλλʼ ὑπέμεινε μιῆς ἐ. θυγατρός

pleasing, acceptable, οὐδέ τί μοι ποδάνιπτρα ποδῶν ἐπιήρανα θυμῷ Od. 19.343.

data.quote: οὐδέ τί μοι ποδάνιπτρα ποδῶν ἐπιήρανα θυμῷ

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom., helping, assisting, Μινύαις ἐπιήρανος Orph. A. 98 (prob.).
ruling, governing, Ἀθηνάων ἐπιήρανε IG 14.1389 ii1, cf. Nonn. D. 2.683; σοφῶν ἐ. ἔργων Emp. 129.3; καλῶν ἐ. ἔργων, of Dionysus, Ion Eleg. 1.15.
warding off, repelling, ἐπιήρανος ἀσπὶς ἀκόντων AP 9.41 (Theon).
νεύρων ἐπιή ρανος strengthening, giving tension, Pl.Com. 173.19.
writer of epithalamia, Tz. adLyc.p.1 S.
belonging to a bridal, nuptial, ἐπιβουλή Luc. Salt. 44; ἐ. ᾠδαί D.H. Rh. 4.1.

definition: ἐπιθαλαμίτης [ ῑ], ου, ὁ, epith. of Hermes in Euboea, Hsch.
ἐπιθαλασσίδιος, Att. ἐπιθαλαττίδιος, ον, = sq., Th. 4.76, X. HG 3.4.28, Pl. Lg. 704b, etc.; ἐπιθαλαττιαῖος is prob. f.l. in Str. 2.1.16, 3.4.20.
ἐπιθαλάσσιος, Att. ἐπιθαλάττιος, α, ον Pl. Lg. 704d, PRev.Laws 93.5 (iii B.C.), also ος, ον X. HG 3.1.16:—

children.definition: lying or dwelling on the coast, Hdt. 1.154; τὰ ἐ. Id. 5.30; ἐ. τῆς Πελοποννήσον Th. 2.56; marine, Epich. 90:—in App. Hisp. 12 ἐπιθάλασσος is prob. f.l.
celebration of the festival of the Corybantes Θάλειοι, SIG 1014.95 ( Erythrae, iii B.C.).
flourish, prob. in Nonn. D. 3.254 ( ἔτι θ. codd.).
Hsch.
warm on the surface, γαῖαν Xenoph. 31, cf. Plu. Ad. princ. ind. 2.780d ( Pass.); [ ᾠά] Ael. NA 10.35.

children.label: II
children.definition: comfort afterwards, BCH 47.284 (Macedonia, Pass.).
warming, δακτύλων prob. in Paul.Aeg. 6.40.
warm, chafe, dub. in Hsch. ( ἐπιθαλάμοντι cod., fort. ἐπιθάλποντι).
marvel at, Nonn. D. 1.60.
condemned to death, D.H. 7.35, LXX Bel ( ό) 31, 1 Ep.Cor. 4.9; ἐ. μέλος, of Arion, Tz. H. 1.400. Adv. -ίως, ἔχειν, = ἐπιθανάτως ἔχειν, Ael. VH 13.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: αἱ ἐ. δᾷδες the funeral torches, Lib. Decl. 40.15; but ἐ. ἐπιστολή deadly, ib. 2.28.
sick to death, hard at deathʼs door, D. 50.60. Adv. -τως, ἔχειν to be sick to death, Poll. 3.106.

children.label: II
children.definition: deadly, ὕβωσις Hp. Mochl. 36; of poisons, Thphr. CP 6.4.5.
bury again, Philostr. Her. 1.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: bury another in the same grave, CIG 4341d ( Attalia), 4366k ( Termessus), sqq.
put trust in or on, θεῶν ἀρωγαῖς Plu. Brut. 37, cf. S.E. M. 1.270.

children.label: II
children.definition: take heart to resist, τοῖς ἐχθροῖς App. BC 3.10, cf. Ael. NA 4.34, 9.1; ἐ. τῷ πελάγει venture on . . , ib. 5.56: abs., take courage, D.C. 41.50, al.
cheer on, encourage, τινά Il. 4.183, D.H. 10.41, Plu. Mar. 36.
pay honour to, ἐ. τι τὸν διδάσκαλον by giving him a fee, Ar. Nu. 1147; ἐπιθαυμάσας τὸ παράλογον in wonder at . . , Plu. Marc. 30: abs., Arr. Epict. 1.26.12.
invoke the gods against, τῷ πατρί Pherecr. 118: abs., ἀγανακτῶν καὶ ἐ. with imprecations, Pl. Phdr. 241b.
survey, examine, Sch. Ar. Nu. 499; look at, τὸν οὐρανόν Agath. 5.3; reflect on a thing, Poll. 6.115.
building adjoining a theatre, IG 11(2).287 A 94,120 ( Delos, iii B.C.).
call upon in the name of the gods, adjure, conjure, τοσαῦτα ἐπιθειάσας Th. 2.75; ἐ. μὴ κατάγειν Id. 8.53; τῷ λόγῳ Plu. Them. 28.

children.label: II
children.definition: inspire, τινί Id. Gen.Socr. 2.580d, 589d, Max.Tyr. 37.5.

ascribe to divine influence, τὰς πράξεις Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.579f, cf. Philostr. VS 1.10; treat with reverence, Arr. Epict. 4.1.108, Porph. Chr. 39.

definition: ἐπιθείασις, εως, ἡ, = sq. 1, Plu. Col. 2.1117a (pl.).

children.definition: appeal to the gods, Th. 7.75 (pl.).
inspiration, Poll. 1.16, Ph. 2.299.
given to appeals to heaven, in Sup., Plu. Prov. 2.14.

soothe, assuage, τὴν ὀργήν Plu. Cohib. 2.456a.
cover, Arist. HA 529b8 (v.l. -θημα), LXX Ex. 25.16(17), J. AJ 3.6.5, IG 3.14.18, Ruf. ap. Orib. 4.2.6, Gal. 12.889.
capital of a column, LXX 3 Ki. 7.4 sq.
remedy for external application, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 10, Dsc. Ther. 19.
addition, POxy. 500.14 (ii A.D.); higher bid, PAmh. 2.85.21 (i A.D.).
shaft of an arrow, Paul.Aeg. 6.88.
Dim. of ἐπίθεμα 3, Gloss.
= Lat. augmentum, Gloss.
care of a statue, IGRom. 4.293a i43, ii62 ( Pergam.).

to be diligent about, work zealously for, τὴν κάθοδον Th. 8.47; court oneʼs favour, ib. 84:— Pass., πρός τινος D.C. Fr. 68.3.

become feverish, Hp. Epid. 1.1, 3.17.ιγʹ.

setting on its base, τοῦ ἀνδριάντος CIG 3124 ( Teos).
laying or putting on, opp. ἀφαίρεσις, Arist. Juv. 470a11; τῶν χειρῶν Act.Ap. 8.18, etc.; application, περιχρίστων Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.102a, cf. Luc. DDeor. 15[13].1 (prob.).
application of epithets, τὰς ἐ. ποιεῖσθαι Arist. Rh. 1405b22.
imposition of increased burdens, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.134.

children.label: II

Lg. 698b; τῶν ἐ. αἱ μὲν ἐπὶ τὸ σῶμα γίγνονται τῶν ἀρχόντων attempts, Arist. Pol. 1311a31; ἐ. συστῆσαι ἐπί τινα ib. 1306b35; ποιεῖσθαι ib. 1312a20; λῃστῶν PPetr. 3p.60 ( iii B.C., prob.); κατά τινος D.H. 5.7; ἡ διὰ τοῦ πυρὸς ἐ. τοῖς ἔργοις Plb. 1.45.2; of disease, aggravated attack, Sor. 2.49 (pl.).

imposture, deception, Aq. Pr. 11.1, al.
Pythag. name for two, Hsch.
prophesy or divine upon, τῷ τρίποδι Hdt. 4.179.

one must impose, δίκην Pl. Grg. 507d; one must set on, σφραγῖδα τῷ λόγῳ Jul. Or. 4.141c; one must put on, apply, Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 9.2; ἐπίπλασμα Aret. CA 1.4.

children.definition: Med.) one must set upon, τινί Pl. Sph. 231c; τῷ ἀνδρί Id. Smp. 217c.
plotter, impostor, Luc. Trag. 172, Sm. Ps. 1.1, Ptol. Tetr. 165, Vett.Val. 16.11.

ready to attack, θηρίοις X. Mem. 4.1.3; enterprising, στρατηγός ib. 3.1.6, Str. 3.4.5; ἐπιθετικώτατον περὶ πάσας τὰς πράξεις Arist. Pol. 1315a11: -κόν, τό, enterprise, Corn. ND 21.
Ptol. Tetr. 165.

additional, φυλαί D.H. 3.71; esp. at Athens, opp. πάτριος, relatively modern, ἑορταί Isoc. 7.29; τὰ ἐ., opp. τὰ πάτρια, the acquired powers of the Areopagus, Lys. Fr. 178 S., cf. Arist. Ath. 25.2, 3.3; so ἐ. ἐξουσία usurped authority, Plu. Cleom. 10: generally, adventitious, τὰ μὲν τῶν νόμων ἐπίθετα, τὰ δὲ τῆς φύσεως ἀναγκαῖα Antipho Soph. Oxy. 1364.25; ἐπιθυμίαι, opp. κοιναί, Arist. EN 1118b9; ἐ. τῇ φύσει κακά Men. 534.13.

entrusted for conveyance, Lys. Fr. 116S.

Aret. CA 1.1.

inspect, μόσχον Wilcken Chr. 89.3 (ii A.D.); νεκρόν POxy. 475.6 (ii A.D.).
look at, behold, τινά J. AJ 15.7.5.

aspect from the right, Vett.Val. 44.31, Gal. 19.541.
contemplation, τῆς τῶν ὅλων φύσεως M.Ant. 8.26.

aspect, Ptol. Tetr. 193.
one must consider, πότερον . . Sor. 1.97, cf. Gal. 8.165, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 7.8.3.

aspecting from the right, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.155.15.
whet or sharpen yet more, τὰ κέντρα Ael. NA 5.16: metaph., stimulate yet more, τὰς ἐπιθυμίας Plu. An seni 786b.
addition, increase, Hes. Op. 380; κἀπιθήκην τέτταρας and 4 loaves (or perh. obols) over, Ar. V. 1391; adponam epithecam insuper, cj. for apo- in Plaut. Trin. 1025.

something put on (cf. ἐπίθεμα): hence,

lid, cover, φωριαμῶν ἐπιθήματα lids of chests, Il. 24.228, cf. Hippon. 56, Hp. Morb. 2.26, Hdt. 1.48, Arist. Ath. 68.3, IG 2(2).1408; ἀσπίδα ἐ. τῷ φρέατι παράθες Ar. Fr. 295; τοὐπ. τῆς χύτρας ἀφελών Hegesipp.Com. 1.13; slab, used as the top of a table, Ath. 2.49a.
monument, sepulchral figure, Is. 2.36, Paus. 1.2.3.
head of a spear, D.S. 5.30.
device on a shield, Paus. 5.25.9.
application, Aret. CA 1.1, 2.2.
concerned with ἐπιθήματα, -κή (sc. τέχνη) Poll. 7.208.
making of lids or covers, Pl. Plt. 280d.
put a lid upon, τι Anticl. 13.
contingent of four elephants, Ascl. Tact. 9, Ael. Tact. 23.
officer commanding such a contingent, ll.cc.
touch, Thphr. Od. 11, Agath. 2.24; τῆς κεφαλῆς Plu. TG 19.

IG 5(2).429 ( Phigalea).

turbid, ὕδωρ Lyd. Ost. 8.

VP 24.107; τὸ κρῖνον Agath. 3.11:— Pass., become turbid, Placit. 3.5.8, Gal. 6.57, Luc. Lex. 4: metaph., ἡ ψυχὴ -οῦται οὔτε φόβοις οὔτε ἐλπίσιν Artem. 4 Prooem.; τὰ θεωρήματα μηδὲν -ούμενα ὑπʼ ἀλλοτρίων δοξασμάτων Iamb. in Nic. p.4P., cf. Myst. 5.4, Just. Nov. 22.20.2.

Clem.Al. Strom. 5.119, Tab.Defix. Aud. 271.45 ( Hadrumetum, iii A.D.)); of political attachments, τῶν ἡμετέρων πολεμίων And. 4.28; ὀλιγαρχίας Lys. 20.3: c. inf., desire to do, πλῶσαι Hdt. 1.24; ἀπικνέεσθαι ib. 116; περισσὰ δρᾶν S. Tr. 617, etc.: abs., desire, covet, Th. 6.92; ὁ ἀεὶ -ῶν Pl. Prt. 313d, etc.; τὸ ἐπιθυμοῦν τοῦ πλοῦ, = ἐπιθυμία, eagerness for it, Th. 6.24:— Pass., to be desired, τὰ ἐπιθυμούμενα Pl. Phlb. 35d.
object of desire, Pl. Lg. 687c (sg.), Arist. EN 1118a13, X. Hier. 4.7 (pl.).

children.definition: yearning, desire, Hp. de Arte 1, Antipho Soph. 110, Epicur. Fr. 141: pl., Philyll. 30.
longing, desire, κακῶν Is. Fr. 158.

definition: ἐπιθυμήτειρα, ἡ, fem. of sq., Call. Dian. 237.

children.definition: one who longs for or desires, νεωτέρων ἔργων Hdt. 7.6; [ δογμάτων] And. 4.6; ἔργων Lys. 12.90; τιμῆς, σοφίας, Pl. R. 475b, etc.; φύσει πολέμου ἐ. Arist. Pol. 1253a6; κακῶν 1 Ep.Cor. 10.6; ἀλλοτρίων BGU 531 ii 22 (ii A.D.).
lover, follower, X. Mem. 1.2.60.

children.label: b
children.definition: one who lusts, LXX Nu. 11.34.

definition: ἐπιθυμητικός (hyperdor. ἐπιθῡμ-ᾱτικός Diotog. ap. Stob. 4.7.62), ή, όν,

children.definition: desiring, coveting, lusting after, τινός Pl. R. 475b, al.; τὸ ἐ. that part of the soul which is the seat of the desires and affections, ib. 439e, Arist. EN 1102b30, etc. Adv. -κῶς, ἔχειν τινός, = ἐπιθυμεῖν, Hell.Oxy. 16.4, Pl. Phd. 108a, Isoc. 15.244, D.L. 8.1; ἐ. διακεῖσθαι Palaeph. 23.
desired, to be desired, -τὸν τὸ φαινόμενον καλόν Arist. Metaph. 1072a27, cf. Rh. 1371a33, etc.; of the cravings of pregnant women, Sor. 1.53. Adv. -τῶς EM 148.7.

desire, yearning, ἐ. ἐκτελέσαι Hdt. 1.32; ἐπιθυμίᾳ by passion, opp. προνοίᾳ, Th. 6.13: generally, appetite, Pl. Cra. 419d, etc.; αἱ κατὰ τὸ σῶμα ἐ. Id. Phd. 82c; esp. sexual desire, lust, Democr. 234 (pl.), Pl. Phdr. 232b, etc.; αἱ πρὸς τοὺς παῖδας ἐ. X. Lac. 2.14.

longing after a thing, desire of or for it, ὕδατος, τοῦ πιεῖν, Th. 2.52, 7.84, etc.; τοῦ πλέονος Democr. 224; τῆς τιμωρίας Antipho 2.1.7; τῆς μεθʼ ὑμῶν πολιτείας And. 2.10; τῆς παρθενίας Pl. Cra. 406b; εἰς ἐ. τινὸς ἐλθεῖν Id. Criti. 113d; ἐν ἐ. τινὸς εἶναι Id. Prt. 318a, Tht. 143e; γεγονέναι Id. Lg. 841c; εἰς ἐ. τινὸς ἀφικέσθαι θεάσασθαι Id. Ti. 19b; ἐ. τινὸς ἐμβαλεῖν τινί X. Cyr. 1.1.5; ἐ. ἐμποιεῖν ἔς τινα an inclination towards . ., Th. 4.81.

children.label: II
children.definition: object of desire, ἐπιθυμίας τυχεῖν Thales ap. Stob. 3.1.172, cf. Lync. ap. Ath. 7.295a; ἀνδρὸς ἐ., of woman, Secund. Sent. 8; πενήτων ἐ., of sleep, prob. in ib. 13.
incense-offering, S. OT 913, prob. in BGU 1.10 (ii/iii A.D.).
offering of incense, CIG 3068 A 24 ( Teos).
one who burns incense, CIG 2983 ( Ephesus).

offer incense, Plu. Alex. 25, CIG 2715.6 ( Stratonicea): c.acc., τῷ Βορέᾳ λιβανίδιον prob. in Men. 260 ( -ίσας codd. Ath.), cf. Plu. Isid. 2.372d; λιβανωτόν Milet. 3.145 (iii/ii B.C.), SIG 694.43 ( Pergam., ii B.C.), Artem. 4.2:— Pass., λίβανος ἐπιθυμιαθείς Dsc. 1.68.
wreath of flowers for the neck, Hsch. (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐπιθῠμίς, ίδος, ἡ, = θύμος, Ps. Dsc. 3.36.
eager for dinner, Plu. QConv. 2.726a.
a parasitic plant growing on thyme, Cuscuta Epithymum, Dsc. 4.177, Gal. 6.414, 11.875, Artem. 1.77.
desirous, Gloss.
S. Ph. 1059: Ep. Iterat. -εσκεν A.R. 3.1325: c.dat., ἔργοις Man. 2.340.
over a door, ἀσπίδες IG 4.1488.22 (Epid.).

children.label: II
children.definition: fixed on a door, ἧλοι ib. 2(2).1408.20.

children.label: III
children.definition: Subst. ἐπιθύριον, τό, lintel, ib. 11(2).165.11 ( Delos, iii B.C.).

definition: ἐπίθυρον, τό, = foreg. III, BCH 6.34 ( Delos, ii B.C.), Princeton Exp.Inscr. 1177.

children.definition: offer incense, Sophr. 120.
sacrificial victims, IG 2(2).1672.295.
burning of incense, BMus.Inscr. 789 ( Cnidus), Ph.Bybl. ap. Eus. PE 1.10 codd.; λιβανωτοῦ καὶ ἀρωμάτων OGI 383.142 (pl., Nemrud Dagh, i B.C.).
one who burns incense, Gloss.; so prob. in CIG 3663 A 15 ( Cyzicus).
sacrifice upon, h.Ap. 491 (tm.); sacrifice besides or after, τέλεον νεαροῖς ἐπιθύσας A. Ag. 1504; ἐπὶ δʼ ἔθυσα μητέρα E. Or. 562:— Med., Νέρωνι Γάλβαν ἐ. Plu. Galb. 14, cf. Marc. 29, Artem. 1.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: burn incense, LXX 3 Ki. 12.33, J. BJ 7.3.3, D.S. 12.11, 18.61, Porph. Abst. 2.59; λιβανωτόν D.S. 18.61, v.l. in Ar. Pl. 1116: generally, offer on, ἐπὶ τοῦ βωμοῦ τὰς δεκάτας D.H. 1.40 codd.
rush eagerly at, ὡς ἂν ἐπιθύσαντες ἑλοίμεθα Od. 16.297: c.gen., ἐπιθύουσι βοῶν λίες Euph. 35a: c.dat., Opp. C. 1.281, 385.

inf., strive vehemently to do a thing, ἐρύσσασθαι . . Τρῶες ἐπιθύουσι Il. 18.175; θυμὸς ἐπιθύει κιθαρίζειν h.Merc. 475; δεδαῆσθαι A.R. 2.1154; κύσσαι . . στόμα Id. 1.1238:— Med., rush upon, flood, Νεῖλος ἐπεθύσατο (sic) αὔλακι γαίης Epic.Anon. in BKT 5(1).119. (Prob. a compound of ἰθύω [ῠ], with ῡ metri gr.: taken as ἐπῐ-θύω by Epic.Anon. l.c.)
under penalty of a fine fornon-attendance, βουλὴ ἀγειρέσθω ἡ δηυοσίη ἐ. Schwyzer 687 B 6 ( Chios, vii/vi B.C.).
tunic worn over the θώραξ, Plu. Art. 11.
put on oneʼs armour, v.l. for θωρακίζομαι (q.v.).
Hsch.; cf. τωθάζω.
shout or call out, give loud commands, A. Pr. 73; οὐκ ἀκούσαις ἐπεθώϋξας τοῦτο thou didst urge this upon not unwilling ears, ib. 279; κάλαμος . . κώπαις ἐπιθωΰξει E. IT 1127.
AP 6.175 ( Maced.).
preside at sacrifice, Gloss.
sit on, ἑῇ ἕδρῃ Q.S. 6.38.

definition: ἐπιίζομαι, Ion. for ἐφέζομαι, Luc. Epigr. 11.403 [47].

children.definition: privy to a thing: c.gen., μεγάλων ἔργων ἐ. privy to great works (i.e. the robbery of the mares), Od. 21.26; so τεῶν μύθων ἐ. A.R. 4.89: abs., ib. 16.
acquainted with, practised in, δίσκων, γεωμετρίης, AP 11.371 ( Pall.), App.Anth. 7.2 ( Euc.); σοφίης IG 3.946, cf. Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.172.
laugh loud, PMag.Leid. W. 11.50, Hsch.
exult in, τινί Q.S. 1.161; exult over, ib. 643: abs., Id. 2.374.
fixing of buckets on a water-wheel, PLond. 3.1177.178, al. (ii A.D.).
pull down or destroy besides, Th. 8.20.
purge yet more, Hp. Judic. 11, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.169 ( Pass.); of supplementary menstruation, Sor. 1.28 ( Pass.).
cleaning, τοῦ ναοῦ IG 4.1484.109 (Epid.).
sit down upon, ἐπί τινι Ar. Pl. 185; [ ἐλέφαντι] Gal. UP 17.1: aor. 1 part. ἐπικαθεσθείς Artem. 2.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be supported, rest on, ἐπιζυγίδα -ομένην τῷ διαπήγματι Hero Bel. 83.11, cf. J. AJ 8.3.5.
sleep upon, τινί Luc. Ind. 4; sit on eggs, Arist. HA 542b20: metaph., go to sleep over, i.e. neglect, τινί Just. Nov. 88.2.1.
boil in as well, Philu n. Ven. 14.6 ( Pass.).
nail fast to, Apollod. Poliorc. 146.7 ( Pass.).

sit upon, τινί Hdt. 6.72, Ar. Eq. 1093; press upon, be heavy upon, ἐπί τινι Id. Ra. 1046: also c.acc., ἐ. καμήλους App. Syr. 32; πόλις . . λόφον ἐπικαθημένη D.H. 1.14: abs., sit upon eggs, incubate, Arist. HA 558a19, 619b14; of bees, ἐ. ἐπὶ τοῖς κηρίοις ib. 625a5.
ἐ. ἐπὶ τῆς τραπέζης (v.l. ἐπὶ τῇ τρ.) sit at his counter, of a bankerʼs clerk or money-changer, D. 49.17, cf. 33: abs., ὁ ἐπικαθήμενος Id. 36.7.
cling to a flower, Thphr. CP 3.24.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: sit down against a place, besiege it, abs., Th. 7.27: c.dat., App. Mith. 78.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐπικαθήμενοι, οἱ, settlers, residents, PTeb. 391.11 (i A.D.).
ἐπὶ τὴν κεφαλήν Antiph. 202.12.

set upon, τινὰ ἐπί τι Hp. Art. 78: abs., (sc. κλίμακι) ibid.; τινὰ ἐν ἅρματι LXX 4 Ki. 10.16; ἐν ὅπλοις ἀφανῶς ἐ. τὸ στρατιωτικόν J. AJ 18.3.1:— Med., φυλακὴν ἐπεκαθίσαντο had a guard set, Th. 4.130 ( ἐπικαθίσταντο Poppo).

data.quote: ἐν ὅπλοις ἀφανῶς ἐ. τὸ στρατιωτικόν

children.label: II
children.definition: sit upon, πειθώ τις ἐπεκάθιζεν ἐπὶ τοῖς χείλεσι Eup. 94.5; τοῖς καρχησίοις ἐ. light upon, Plu. Them. 12, cf. Thphr. CP 6.10.5.

data.quote: πειθώ τις ἐπεκάθιζεν ἐπὶ τοῖς χείλεσι

children.definition: sit down against, besiege, πόλει Plb. 4.61.6.
let down, set upon, τι βακτηρίᾳ Ephipp. 14.11; insert, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.53.
let down, shut, πύλας App. Hann. 51.
put down the foot, Hp. Art. 60.
incise or prick again, Gal. ap. Orib. 7.5.12.
impose a surcharge or penalty, IG 5(1).1421.15 ( Cyparissia, iv/iii B.C.).
= Lat. insessus, Gloss.
set upon, establish, φυλακάς D.C. 41.50; cf. ἐπικαθίζω.
set over, κριτάς Pl. Ti. 72b.

establish besides, τὴν τῶν ἐφόρων ἀρχήν Arist. Pol. 1313a27; ἐ. τινὰ στρατηγόν appoint as successor in command, Plb. 2.19.8, cf. J. AJ 17.2.4:— Pass., ἐπικατασταθεὶς στρατηγός Plb. 2.2.11, cf. IG 5(1).1390.12 ( Andania).
pay in addition, Leg.Gort. 1.47; but simply, deliver, σῖτον ἐπὶ τοὺς ὅρμους PLille 53 (iii B.C.).
perform the manoeuvre of ἀντικατάστασις, Ascl. Tact. 12.11:— Pass., of troops executing the manoeuvre, ib. 10.11.
to be kept moist, Sor. 1.44, Orib. Fr. 144, Paul.Aeg. 3.63.
renew, restore, LXX 1 Ma. 10.44 ( Pass.).
contrive novelties, Democr. 191.
introduce innovations into, μὴ ʼπικαινούντων νόμους A. Eu. 693 ( Steph. for μὴ ʼπικαινόντων).
surpass, excel (v. καίνυμαι), πάντας ἐπʼ ἀνθρώπους ἐκέκαστο ὄλβῳ τε πλούτῳ τε Il. 24.535.

data.quote: πάντας ἐπʼ ἀνθρώπους ἐκέκαστο ὄλβῳ τε πλούτῳ τε

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be adorned or furnished with, ἐπὶ φρεσὶ πευκαλίμῃσι κέκασται 20.35 (unless in signf. 1); οἷς ἐπικαίνυται ἵππος (cj. for ἐπικίνυται) Q.S. 12.145.
opportunity, Hp. Gland. 4; αἰτίαι περὶ ἀκαιριῶν καὶ ἐ., title of work by Democr., D.L. 9.48.
= sq., Sup. -ώταται, πράξεις X. Oec. 5.4, cf. Vett.Val. 293.22. Adv. -ίως conveniently, ἵδρυται Str. 9.2.15, cf. 10.1.7.

important, τὰ -ώτατα τῆς τέχνης X. Oec. 15.11; of persons, οἱ ἐ. the most important persons of the army, Id. Cyr. 3.3.12, cf. HG 3.3.11: c. inf., οἱ θεραπεύεσθαι ἐπικαίριοι those whose cure is all-important, Id. Cyr. 8.2.25.
vital, τόποι ἐ. Ti.Locr. 102d.

in fit time or place, seasonable, opportune, S. OT 875 (lyr.), Th. 6.34; νίκη -οτάτη Id. 8.106; of places, -ότατον χωρίον πρὸς τὰ ἐπὶ Θρᾴκης ἀποχρῆσθαι Id. 1.68; τὰ ἐ. advantageous positions, X. Hier. 10.5; τοὺς ἐ. τῶν τόπων D. 18.27, cf. Arist. Pol. 1331a21; Κόρκυρα ἐν -οτάτῳ κειμένη Isoc. 15.108; τὰ ἐνδεχόμενα καὶ -ότατα Arist. Rh. 1396b5; τοῦ πάθους τὸ ἐ. spontaneous outburst of passion, Longin. 18.2: also c.gen., τρίποδα . .λουτρῶν ἐπίκαιρον, = καιρὸν ἔχοντα λουτρῶν, convenient for . ., S. Aj. 1406 (anap.); ἰατὴρ -ότατος helping in time of need, Pi. P. 4.270. Adv. -ως Sm. Ps. 9.10, Sup. -οτάτως Anon. in Rh. 132.8.

data.quote: -ότατον χωρίον πρὸς τὰ ἐπὶ Θρᾴκης ἀποχρῆσθαι

children.definition: serious, important, ἐ. σημεῖα important symptoms, Hp. Epid. 1.25; ἐς τέκμαρσιν Id. Acut. 1.

vital, ἐν τῷ -οτάτῳ ἀφύλακτον X. Eq. 12.7, cf. Arist. GA 766a24; ἐ. τοῦ ζῆν necessary for life, ib. 719a16; of wounds, dangerous, ἐ. τρῶμα Hp. Fract. 11; ἕλκος Id. Acut. 46. Adv. -ρως, τετρῶσθαι Paus. 4.8.4.
susceptible to disorders, Gal. Nat.Fac. 2.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: for a time, temporary, opp. ἀΐδιος, Epict. Gnom. 8; ἡ τῆς δόξης ἐ. εὐδαιμονία Vett.Val. 130.30.
light up or kindle on a place, πῦρ h.Ap. 491; burn on an altar, ὅς μοι πολλὰ βοῶν ἐπὶ μηρίʼ ἔκηεν Il. 22.170, cf. Od. 3.9, 17.241.

data.quote: ὅς μοι πολλὰ βοῶν ἐπὶ μηρίʼ ἔκηεν

children.label: II
children.definition: burn on the surface, scorch, Hp. Aër. 17 ( Pass.); οἱ τὰ σώματα ὑπὸ τῶν ἡλίων ἐπικεκαυμένοι Pl. Ep. 340d; τῷ χρώματι παρὰ φύσιν -κεκαυμένος Plb. 38.8.7, cf. Apollon. Mir. 23; ἀέρα -όμενον Antipho Soph. 26; of lightning, Arist. Mete. 371b14; of hot iron, Id. HA 631b26; of cold, Hp. Aër. 20, Thphr. CP 2.1.6 (v.l.); of a caustic drug, Dsc. 3.35.

data.quote: οἱ τὰ σώματα ὑπὸ τῶν ἡλίων ἐπικεκαυμένοι

children.definition: burn on the top, of stumps, Plu. Vit.pud. 2.529b; of pruning trees by burning, Thphr. HP 6.6.6; cauterize, τὰ χείλη τῶν τραυμάτων Aët. 13.4, cf. Philum. Ven. 3.5, al.
brand, ἵππον PCair.Zen. 93.4 (iii B.C.).

definition: ἐπικακτίς, ίδος, ἡ, prob. f.l. for ἐπιπακτίς, Plin. HN 13.114, 27.76.

children.definition: glean after the reapers, Luc. Tox. 16.
fields whose corn is in stalk, PTeb. 115.4, al. (ii B.C.).

definition: ἐπικαλαμίς, ίδος, ἡ, f.l. for ἐπισκαλμίς, Agath. 5.22.

children.definition: in the stalk, AB 291 (cf. καλάμη); αἱ ἀπὸ ἐπικαλάμου ἄρουραι fields whose corn is in stalk, POxy. 499.10 (ii A.D.).

summon a god to a sacrifice or as witness to an oath, etc., invoke, θεόν Hdt. 2.39, 3.8, al.; ἐπὶ δὲ κάλεσον Ἄρτεμιν Ar. Lys. 1280, cf. Act.Ap. 7.59, etc.; ἐ. θεόν τινι invoke a god over one, to be gracious to him, Hdt. 1.199; or, watch over his good faith, Id. 3.65:— Med., Id. 1.87, al., X. HG 2.3.55, al.; ἐπικαλεσάμενος τὸν θεόν OGI 194.18 ( Egypt, i B.C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: pray for, πρὸ καιροῦ τὸν θάνατον PLond. 5.1676.24 (vi A.D.).
invite, γέροντας ἐπὶ πλέονας καλέσαντες Od. 7.189:— Med., Hdt. 1.187, al.

children.label: II
